author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1413185644}
review: Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a fun HOG. It has good puzzles, nice hidden object scenes, and an interesting story. It also has  stupid dominos which I don't think belong in a HOG. A HOG is about the hidden object scenes and the option to play dominos instead in just dumb. Get it cheap or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158739744', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1526634744}
review:
翻译从商店页面的简介开始就错了，这不是一个找未婚妻的故事，而是未婚妻挽救她脆弱无力易晕倒的汉子的故事。

难度不大，但是属于比较烦的那种，来来回回翻垃圾，来来回回找东西，来来回回走路，来来回回坐电梯......吃我一发差评啦！

成就猎人注意：这款游戏开新周目（全成就必须打两遍以上）可能导致一些成就项目失效，但最后一个成就“达成所有成就”是依靠游戏内置成就栏的统计进行判定的，这就会造成无法顺利解锁最后一个成就得再打一遍的惨剧。

不要问我是怎么知道的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198062804234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1538325286}
review: Causal point and click, cool  city under water story. Breathtaking art as you can see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024311750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1537750791}
review: An older Artifex Mundi-developed hidden object game, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is another fine example of the genre. I thought it was a little lacking when it comes to puzzles compared to other hidden object games I've played and it feels somewhat like a point and click adventure. Despite featuring the ubiquitous trapped-demon stalwarts, the story is decent and it's an enjoyable game overall. The underwater setting is nice as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056468503', 'num_games_owned': 4820, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1537655796}
review: Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is an entertaining adventure game with hidden picture puzzles and awesome atmosphere. Played through the normal campaign so far and liked it. Nice story, nice atmosphere, nice riddles...and if you don't like them you can either play a mini game, skip them or get hints. Furthermore you get the soundtrack, some wallpapers and an extra campaign. I recommend it to people who like old-school point & click adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010499035', 'num_games_owned': 4050, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1536419992}
review:
일단 ABC순으로 나열된 라이브러리에서 입문작.
여자친구와 함께 나란히 앉아서, 숨은그림찾기 게임을 하듯이 플레이.
간단한 퍼즐과 기믹들은, 조촐한 스토리를 무시하고 몰입을 주는 요소가 된다.
기본적으로 플레이 대상을 여성으로 한정해 두고 만든듯한 스토리텔링과, 게임적 요소들에 비해서, 남성들만 알법한 단어들이 많이 숨겨져 있어 타겟유저층과 실제 플레이유저층의 지식수준이 동기화 되지 않은 느낌이 든다.

스토리 ☆☆☆☆☆ - 내용도 유치하고, 발번역 오역이 숨어있다. 스토리에 점수를 줄 요소는 없다.
몰입감 ★☆☆☆☆ - 기억을 해야 하는 요소들이 많다보니, 몰입도가 올라가지만 플레이 시간이 길어질수록 몰입도가 떨어진다.
재미 ★★☆☆☆ - 연속되는 기믹들을 발견할떄마다 깨알같은 잔재미가 있다.
조작감 ★☆☆☆☆ - 확실한 클릭 포인트를 찾기 힘들다. 다른 유사게임들보다는 기본적인 가이드가 있는 점은 좋다.
인터페이스 ★☆☆☆☆ - 어느정도 발전을 거듭한 인터페이스인지는 모르겠지만...불편하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045380427', 'num_games_owned': 4982, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1527372593}
review:
[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33025671-Missi-the-Achievement-Huntress/] Please see my curator page for more games that are worth your time [/url][/code]

Approximate amount of time to 100%: 10h
Estimated achievement difficulty: 6/10
Minimum number of playthroughs needed: 2, One in which you solve all the hidden-objective scenes and one expert game in which you complete all the domino puzzles
Has it been in a bundle: Yes
Is there a good guide available: Yes [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1375694151] here [/url]
How many people have complete this game at the time I'm writing this review: 1430 on Astats

Multiplayer achievements: No
Missable achievements: Yes, don't ask for hints during the game. Complete one playthough with all the hidden-objective scenes and one playthough (on expert) with the domino games.
Grinding Achievements: No
DLC-Only achievements: No
Time-gated achievements: No
RNG-achievements: No
Does difficulty affect achievements: Yes, one playthough one expert is needed.
Unobtainable/glitched achievements: No

I like those story drive hidden objective games. This is no exception. Warning: if you screw up something, don't start a new game right away to just get that one achievement. Because both games with domino and hidden objectives has to be on the same profile and you can't quite a run while in the middle of it. I had to play this game 3 times because I made that mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006807283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1535143321}
review:
Небольшой Bioshock в виде поиска предметов. Подводный город - утопия рушиться под гнетом сверхестественных сил Легатов. Вам прийдется найти жениха, освободить город, и спасти оставшееся население.

Исходя из описания вам нужно искать невесту, но на самом деле вы играете за девушку, а ищите пропавшего жениха. Мистика видимо, один из обязательных элементов такого типа игр, другое дело насколько хорошо она вписана в сюжет. И с сюжетом тут все стандартно: линейный, логичный, в меру интересный. Вроде бы все ладно, но стоит выделить странно нарисованных детей (в статике), малопонятную головоломку с разноцветными, вращающимися шариками, отсутствие быстрого перемещения по карте, и множество сложных названий в поиске предметов (когда не понимаешь значения слова, например название рыбы). В остальном, все в лучших традициях издательства Artifex Mundi: качественные видеовставки, хорошо прориссованные локации, локализация текста и картинок на русский язык, стандартные ачивменты, разнообраные головоломки, альтернатива игре в поиск предметов.

Играть в детектива практически не прийдется, касательно сложности игры. Средний хронометраж игры равен 4 часам. Малозапоминающийся, но достойный мистический роман.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1531253699}
review:
Enjoyed this Artifex Mundi offering quite a bit.  While many of their published games are good, I've begun to notice that the ones where AM is the developer (as well as publisher) are just that much better.  

This particular game seemed a tiny bit short, but the story was interesting with the right amount of immersive creepiness (not much, but the atmosphere definitely works).  All I can say is that the protagonist is a truly brave woman.  It was fun, it had all the elements I was looking for, and I'm glad I added it to my AM collection!

A solid 8.5/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990448462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1532368785}
review:
Artifex Mundi have always distinguished themselves on having cool hidden-object games that stumble with the "adventure-light" portions that connect them, but Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden seems to break that curse. 

It keeps the fun of the hidden object screens (along with the standard Artifex Mundi mini-puzzles built in to liven it up) but the point-and-click adventure portions that connect them really come together this time and tell a fun story with more puzzles and game pieces that feel grounded in the game world, rather than an infinite array of silly-shaped keys.

Explore a Bioshock-inspired underwater city and piece together what happened to its citizens while working past some mild jump-scares.

If you're looking for a pure point-and-click adventure, there's better games out there, but Abyss is surely the best hidden-object/adventure hybrid I've had the pleasure of playing.

review: This is one of my favorite hidden object games. Unlike a lot of them, the story in this one is actually pretty engaging. The art is great and I found the scenes to be well put together. I love the underwater environments as well. Puzzles are easy to grasp, so you don't have the frustration of zero instructions. I definitely recommend this one, it is one of the few HOGs I would actually replay!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997740965', 'num_games_owned': 8001, 'num_reviews': 2015, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1530492915}
review:
Всех приветствую! Сегодня завершил свое приключение в прекрасной Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden.
 Игра выступает в жанре *поиск предметов*, но очень качественно и профессионально. Первым делом начинаешь тонуть в знакомой атмосфере игры, которая манит схожестью с миром первых частей BioShock и SOMA. Это не преувеличение, друзья, в этот мир начинаешь верить и сопереживать событиям подводного города. Музыкальное сопровождение не мешает, а всячески подталкивает на волну с игрой. Головоломки привычны и знакомы по другим играм этого жанра, сам поиск предметов выполнен в классическом виде и не содержит собственных фишек, но это разве отталкивает? 
 Первая и вторая стадия прохождения в плане сюжета очень понравилась, а вот финал пестрит спорными логическими действиями, событиями и несколько отталкивает. Увы и их, но это общая болезнь  всех игр такого жанра.  Такое ощущение, что каждый раз разработчиков  заставляют закончить игру под страхом смерти, но это мои больные догадки. 
 После прохождения основной игры нам выдадут бонусную главу, которую можно найти в закладках (бонусы). Мелочь, но крайне приятно провести дополнительное время в приятной атмосфере.
 Если говорить честно, друзья, это одна из самых хороших игр подобного жанра в стиме на данный момент. Отталкивают только *смешные* противники, но у всех есть воображение, правда? 
 Могу с уверенностью советовать казуальным игрокам, любителям *поиска предметов* и меломанам-геймерам. Приятной всем игры, берегите нервы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054808105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1541617520}
review:
I have not been able to finish this game. I've tried three times and I get bored and can't go on every time. It's not that it's a Artifex Mundi game, and it's not that it's clearly inspired by Bioshock (I kind of like that aspect?); it's just somehow incredibly boring. 

These games don't have great writing and the voice acting is worse but there's always been some thing about other AM games that keep me playing. I've played five or six of them now and every few months I pick up another one, so it's not that I have a problem with the genre. 

Maybe it's that there are fewer hidden object scens? I don't know. I don't like this one.

edit: So I finally (finally) finished this monster and I think I have a better idea now of why I hate this game so much. 

Most AD games I've played gradually cordon off earlier areas of the map as you progress so that you're always dealing with a manage chunk of map to keep in your head at any one time. They also allow fast travel; the advantages there are obvious. Abyss does neither (it does block off a small beginning part of the map but nothing after you enter Eden proper) and it makes getting through the already clumsy story infuriatingly tedious. They clearly made these choices because they were trying to make a horror game and they probably thought making you walk everywhere would increase tension or whatever. 

But the game is also really bad at doing anything scary; so maintaining tension by restricting map movement is kind of a moot point. The 'scary parts' are relegated to a handful of tame jump scares that are heavily telegraphed in advance. And I want to be clear here; I'm not a horror snob. I'm easily scared. My issue isn't that the game wasn't scary enough but rather that AM sacrificed player movement and story flow for a genre they were throughly unable to do any justice to.

It's a bad game. The story's also un-engaging and the puzzles weren't good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1529845628}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

La direction artistique à la Bioshock est plaisante, ainsi que la musique. Graphiquement, c'est pas mal, dans la moyenne des Artifex Mundi. Les puzzles sont trop peu nombreux à mon goût, et j'en ai déjà vu une bonne partie dans d'autres jeux du même éditeur, faudrait penser à renouveler :).

Au niveau des scènes d'objets cachés... elles sont moyennes. Rien de dur, rien de trop facile non plus. Mais la difficulté vient souvent des traductions, qui sont vraiment faites n'importe comment... il faut arrêter de faire des traductions sans montrer les objets aux traducteurs - ou arrêter d'utiliser des outils de traduction automatiques (ex: Spring->Source au lieu de Spring->Ressort).

La partie bonus est courte et offre un prologue au jeu principal, mettant l'histoire en place.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Le jeu se termine assez vite, environ 3h30. Comptez entre 1h et 2h pour le refaire en mode dominos. J'ai un temps de jeu un peu supérieur car je l'ai refait plusieurs fois, ayant raté certains jeux de dominos lors des puzzles de construction d'objets...

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Une bonne petite aventure d'Artifex Mundi, ambiance Bioshock.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

Comme pour tous les jeux Artifex Mundi auxquels j'ai joué, la version Linux est excellente. Je n'ai rencontré aucun problème.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 760, Nvidia 570GTX, 8GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 1920x1200 & 1x 1600x1200, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043863729', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1529344557}
review:
Overall Score: C+

Pretty standard hidden-object game. Which of course means that, at times, it's frustrating to see things in your inventory get discarded only for you to need a similar object 2 scenes later. Why are you throwing away the screwdriver/knife/flashlight after you use it one time?! Of course, without that mechanic, there wouldn't be much of a game.  Also, why is the same tool called a spatula in one hidden-object scene, then a scraper in a later one?

Graphically, this game has a pretty interesting art style, what with the (seemingly Bioshock-inspired) undersea art deco civilization, as long as things (people, mostly) aren't moving. The moment characters start to move their mouths to talk, they seem more inhuman than the wraiths. The Abyss mentioned in the title is probably the uncanny valley.

I knew what I was getting into when I started, though, so overall, I'll still give it a thumbs up. If you like the genre, then I don't see any reason why you wouldn't like this game. If you don't like the genre, you're probably not interested in this game, anyway. If you're curious about hidden-object games, but haven't played one before, this might not be the best one to cut your teeth on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308019923', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1529146676}
review:
La prima cosa che vorrei sottolineare è che questo gioco non è un "punta e clicca" e neppure un'avventura grafica, ma un hidden objects... qualcosa di ben diverso.
Premesso questo, ed inquadrato il genere, rimanendo nel suo ambito (hidden objects) potrebbe interessare, a poco prezzo, gli amanti di questa tipologia di giochi (schifando, invece, tutti gli altri) tenendo presente però che:
1) La trama è insulsa
2) Tecnicamente è scadente
3) La traduzione in italiano è oscena (in tutti i sensi... il gioco inizia ed uno dei primi oggetti da trovare sarà la PASSERA).

author: {'steamid': '76561198435157201', 'num_games_owned': 4819, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1528340576}
review: 不得不说，《伊甸的愤怒》这一作的剧情设置、解谜流程确实可圈可点。一种科学和玄学迷之混合的氛围还是挺有趣的。就是成就的设置过于反人类，即使你一周目玩的专家模式，也没有办法一周目全成就，因为“隐藏物品收集”要素和“多米诺游戏”要素的成就是互相冲突的！这意味着，在通关一遍以后，还需要把完全相同、已经失去解谜新意的流程再机械地走一遍，这明明是毫无必要的！因为解谜游戏除非有多结局多线路的设定，多周目完全不能带来更好的游戏体验，真不知道这一部的成就系统为什么要设置成这样，真是见了鬼了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4177, 'num_reviews': 733, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1527458103}
review:
[h1] Points positifs : [/h1]

- Un semblant de scénario pas désagréable
- Des personnages charismatiques
- Une petite histoire supplémentaire dans les bonus
- Les énigmes et autres recherches d'objets toujours sympathiques
- Le jeu de mah-jong qui peut potentiellement remplacer les jeux d'objets cachés

[h1] Points négatifs : [/h1]

- Les fins du scénario principal et bonus ridiculement minables
- Les nombreux allers/retours entre les énigmes
- Une certaine répétitivité liée à ce genre de jeux
- Durée de vie assez courte (environ 5h)

[h1] En conclusion... [/h1]

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden est un puzzle-game mélant énigmes à résoudre et recherche d'objets cachés. S'il n'envoie pas du rêve au joueur, ce dernier saura tout de même apprécier les quelques heures passées à résoudre les différents tableaux qui s'offre à lui. Le scénario donne un intérêt supplémentaire au titre même si les fins sont vraiment décevantes. Les différents allers/retours obligatoires pour avancer dans l'aventure sont récurrents et finissent par lasser, c'est dommage car une certaine fluidité aurait été bien plus appréciée ! >> 13/20

review: A point-and-click adventure with a setting probably inspired by Bioshock, which is a great thing. You’ll need to explore a lot, solve puzzles and hidden object games. What I didn’t enjoy was the constant backtracking without fast travel. Because of that, the game is a bit longer than some games of this genre. Also, to get all achievements you’ll need 2 playthroughs, which is annoying. There’s also a nice bonus chapter that serves as a prologue to the main story. Recommended on sale if you’re a fan of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1525235618}
review:
This is one of Artifex Mundi's mid-tier games. It's got a tight story, with a variety of characters, featuring a woman with a unique skill set (scuba diving and adventuring related skills like knowledge of machinery), saving her fiance? boyfriend? from certain doom. With a Lovecraftian threat in the form of wraiths and a Cthulhuoid deity, a good mix of beautiful art and horrific gross art, and a tight storyline, this game offers both hidden object puzzles, regular puzzles, and domino puzzles for people who want to skip the hidden object sections.

I personally found this to be one of the easier Artifex Mundi games, even on expert mode, but for those new to the genre, this is a good introductory game. Do note there are more horror elements than you'd find in a standard HOPA (there's a few corpses, a few skeletons?, the titular wraiths, some scary animals, and Lovecraftian magic), but I would not categorize this as a horror game, as the overall setting, hidden object puzzles, and standard puzzles did not have a horror tilt. 

There's only one glaring glitch, and this may or may not be a glitch. To get the achievement that has to do with finishing the game on expert mode, you MUST watch the final cut scene. I didn't, and am going to have to play through it again.

Reasons I didn't list this as a top-tier Artifex Mundi game:
- It could have done with more puzzles. There were various times a puzzle might have made sense and wasn't implemented. There were lots of "combine these objects to make a thing" puzzles, involving the inventory, but not a lot of non-inventory based complex puzzles.
- The hidden object scenes could've been harder and there could've been more of them.
- The issue with the achievement. I had to play the game twice on Expert Mode to make the achievement pop. That was four full play throughs: one on regular for the hidden object scene achievements, one on regular for the domino achievements, twice on expert for the expert achievements. You could do it in two tries, getting both the hidden object and domino achievements on two different expert mode runs.
- It was short. In 10 hours, I beat the game four times, and only three of the times were in the last week, for achievement hunting. That's around two and a half to three hours per play through, if I'm being generous.

If you're a fan of games with a Bioshock-type Art Deco aesthetic, and like the idea of exploring an underwater city to solve a mystery, this is definitely a good casual game to play on a rainy day.

If you are looking for another Bioshock-type Art Deco underwater city type of HOPA, with a similar tone, but with a focus on dreams, check out The Emerald Maiden: Symphony of Dreams. That game does not have a puzzle mode available for people that want to skip the hidden object puzzles, but does have collectibles. Abyss also has scarier bits that The Emerald Maiden, and features more adventuring than mystery solving. I would also say that The Emerald Maiden is definitely more historical in terms of tone, and definitely a mystery game as well as a work of historical fiction. The heroine of The Emerald Maiden is exploring an area created contemporaneously with her exploration, whereas the heroine of Abyss is exploring a dilapidated underwater city.

If you just want to check out more HOPAs with a nautical tilt, I absolutely recommend Artifex Mundi's classic Nightmares From The Deep series, which should be played in released order.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267364', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1406868118}
review:
This is one of the many Hidden Object games on Steam by Artifex Mundi, and while that's a humble genre to specialize in they're pretty good at it. The ones made by them tend to feature great visuals for the scenes, weird supernatural plots, and usually the same female voice actor doing all their leads. In Abyss' case it's pretty obviously based on Bioshock, without Ayn Rand or genetic mutation (though the character models on some of the children in the game might make you wonder). 

These sorts of games obviously won't appeal to anyone but if you want something more relaxing and with some puzzles, you won't go too wrong here. If you get stuck there's a hint system, and if you don't feel like doing the actual hidden object scenes you can play dominos instead. It's a decent adventure game and often appears in bundles along with other titles by them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089505080', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1520966119}
review:
Ni os hacéis una idea de los tirones de pelo para conseguir el 100% de este juego. Y no porque sea dificil, el juego en sí es bastante sencillo, sino por perder los datos del juego en varias veces. He tenido que completarlo unas 5 contadas, y acabé completamente quemado. Al meollo.

Abyss es un juego de buscar objetos de fantasía bastado en una ciudad sumergida bajo el mar. Nuestra prota busca a su marido que fue de buceo y desapareció, fue a buscarle y encontró tal lugar. Hasta ahí meh. No es un argumento súper avanzado, pero oye, los he visto peores. Una vez la historia va avanzando, se vuelve peor y cada vez más fantasiosa, incluso llegan a incluir un demonio y posesiones como "boss" final (Que de boss mis huevos, tienes que pickear un item y pinchar en él, uuuuff) Total, que una vez lo terminé quedé con una cara importante. 

El aspecto gráfico, a pesar de ser lo de menos, en este género de juegos acaba siendo importante. Si el jugador no entiende lo que ve, no va a encontrar eso que le mandas buscar. Pero debo admitir de que los he jugado con una calidad gráfica muy impresionante. Eso sí, el sistema de niveles, avance y detalles del género es una pasada, y no es para menos. El estudio que lo desarrolló cuenta con ingentes cantidades de juegos del género. Son unos veteranos y unos profesionales. 

Las animaciones son sinceramente el peor punto. No solo son pobres sino que algunas se me han buggeado durante esas 5 veces que lo he completado. Y qué hablar del doblaje. Estamos hablando de un estudio con decenas de juegos de este estilo. Genera mucha pasta, qué le costaba doblarlo correctamente. También es cierto que es de 2012, y es posible que sus juegos más recientes sean muchísimo mejores, pero lo importante es que estoy hablando de este. Y hablando de presupuesto, las traducciones. Oh dios, la traducción al español. Horrible. No quisiera saber cómo lo han traducido, pero tengo la sospecha de que fue con un traductor automático. Eso es muy de pobre. Yo mismo estoy desarrollando mis propios juegos y minijuegos, y ya tengo lista una traducción en Inglés completamente profesional. Un estudio se ve su ama sus juegos por como cuida los detalles que van directamente al público, y por aquel 2012, este estudio iba un poco flojo.

Este género es bastante casual. Eso hace que este tipo de juegos sean muy importantes de hacer bien,y de saber qué se hace en todo momento. Este estudio es profesional, y cuenta con mucha experiencia, sí, pero transportándonos a este 2012 las cosas iban realmente mal. E insisto, estamos hablando de un estudio que genera bastante pasta, y si fuese yo, cuidaría de estos juegos antigüos. Actualizaciones, parches, mejoras visuales. Nunca, jamás, nunca abandonéis un juego antigüo, da muy mal imagen. Mantendré este juego instalado y pendiente de parches, porque me gustaría ver como este estudio algún día cuida de sus juegos. Hasta entonces, tendré que dejar mi pulgar abajo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027686399', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1662779605}

author: {'steamid': '76561198255798797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1521230723}
review: Abyss é um jogo bacana de point and click, com uma arte belíssima e uma história de mistério que te faz não querer fechar o jogo até completá-lo. O jogo em si não é desafiador, os puzzles são simples e com um pouquinho de atenção você consegue cumprir todos os objetivos, o que provavelmente agradaria tanto gamers quanto pessoas que estão se familiarizando com o universo dos jogos. É um passatempo bem gostoso! Como ponto bônus, o jogo me causou uma baita nostalgia, porque me remeteu à minha infância, quando eu era apaixonada por jogos nesse estilo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084223806', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1422677617}

author: {'steamid': '76561198260567820', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1517651128}
review:
在解谜游戏中算中等偏上了。
[u] 画面[/u] 85分
如果忽略掉逻辑上的小瑕疵，海底世界描绘还是很美的。CG做的也很逼真。额外章节的女主可撸。
[u] 音乐[/u] 70分
中规中矩
[u] 情节[/u] 80分
一场恋人间的救赎与被救赎，虽然很老套但是我买账。
[u] 解谜设计[/u] 80分
没有大面积的覆盖找物游戏，额外章节除外。小游戏的设计上有吃老本的，也有创新的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1517073291}
review:
This is one of AM games I didn't enjoy much in the beginning, I even left it for months before deciding to finish it. The story is about a woman who's fiance is missing in an expedition to a forgotten underwater city called Eden which was invaded by some wraiths. For me the story was average, there was a couple of jumps scares and some twists. The bonus chapter was a good addition to the story. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282345013

Your adventure will be underwater which is one of the things I don't like much. However, in mid game, I started to enjoy the sceneries.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282345608

Puzzles and hidden objects scenes were relatively easy. What I disliked is the voiceovers, it seems this woman voiced all of AM games but she failed in this one, her emotions sounded so staged. 

Another biggest issue is the map, see how pretty is this map? There is no fast travel option in it. I kept going back and forth in 40 locations as what it is stated in the game features. It felt as if I'm doing the Ooga Chaka Baby dance when I want to reach a certain area, you need to go back two steps, then take something and go to the previous area, it felt like a loop and too painful to backtrack all the time. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1282344387

Pros:
+Beautiful graphics and locations.
+Average story with jump scares.
+Beautiful useful journal.
+Steam achievements.
+Good bonus chapter.

Cons:
-Repetitive soundtracks.
-Bad voice over.
-No fast travel map. (Lots of backtracking)
-Bad characters animations.
-No replay value. (You are already forced to play it twice to get all achievements)
-I disliked the elevator.
-Inventory with no lock to keep it up

It is not the best game out there, but not necessarily a bad one. I do recommend it to people who ran out of HOGs and want to try out an older one. Don't pay full price though, it already been bundled many times.

[quote]𝐹𝑜𝑟 𝑚𝑜𝑟𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑣𝑖𝑒𝑤𝑠 𝑐𝘩𝑒𝑐𝑘 𝑚𝑦 𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑎𝑡𝑜𝑟 𝑝𝑎𝑔𝑒 [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32399565/]𝐹𝑒𝑒𝑛𝑎'𝑠 𝐶𝘩𝑜𝑖𝑐𝑒[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198801863177', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1518061071}
review:
剧情还是做得比较吸引人的，互动也比较多，动画和CG可以无缝对接，总体来说游戏体验非常好！
乌鸦森林系列入坑，感觉比起那个三部曲还是要简单不少，熟悉A社套路的话，应该也不会那么容易被吓飞。所有谜题和找东西不用提示就能过，游戏本体3小时就能通关。没有推理环节，基本上看个地图哪里有感叹号跟着走就好了（谢天谢地不能用地图直接跳转，不然就太简单了）。
成就也比较容易完成，二周目再刷个专家难度就差不多了。
感谢A社又帮我打发了一下午~

author: {'steamid': '76561198131498635', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1516488471}
review:
Zuerst habe ich gedacht: "Oh, Rapture!" Dann dachte ich: "Wohl eher Cthulhu." Aber eigentlich ist die Story schon etwas Eigenes, jedoch mit Ähnlichkeiten zuThematiken, die man bereits kennt. Die Wimmelbilder waren nicht sehr schwer und die Rätsel auch nicht. Für mich genau richtig zum Spielen für Zwischendurch. Wer sein Hirn aber lieber etwas mehr anstrengt, der sollte wohl besser etwas anderes wählen. 

Positiv zu Erwähnen ist noch, dass die Synchronsprecher einen ganz guten Job gemacht haben, was ja leider nicht immer der Fall ist bei WBS. ;-) (Obwohl ich das ganz unterhaltsam finde)

Zum Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis muss ich sagen: Man kann es sich im Sale ruhig kaufen, aber hätte ich den vollen Preis bezahlt, wäre ich etwas enttäuscht gewesen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198312635558', 'num_games_owned': 988, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1514754628}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036732294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1515466955}
review:
4時間でエキストラまでクリアしました。
Artifex Mundi開発の別ゲームが合わなかったので、このゲームも合わないかな・・と心配しながら始めましたが、普通に楽しめました。特に良くないけど、別に悪くもないといった印象です。

ストーリーは単純でしたが、個人的に嫌なタイプではありませんでした (全体の設定は微妙に強引すぎますが・・)。
海なのでクトゥルー神話リスペクトですかね。ラグクラフト氏の本が好きな人におすすめです。
ホラーではないですが、ちょこちょこ驚かせ要素があるので、びっくりゲームが苦手な人はご注意ください。
1点だけ文句をつけるとしたら、おっさんがヒロインポジとかやめてください的なアレですかね。

画像は普通でした。水族館のような青く明るい水面で、色々な魚が泳いでいて、見ていて楽しかったです。
そんな明るい水色の背景に べったりとオレンジの光源を合わせてしまうのがArtifex開発陣のセンスなんですかね。自分の好みとの差を感じますが、全体的にはそこそこ好きな感じに仕上がっていました。ただ、クリア後にコンセプトアートが見れるのですが、コンセプトの色合いの方が断然いいと感じたので、そのままの色合いで製品にならなかったのが残念です。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999921146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1515450066}
review: Un jeu d'Objets Cachés très classique. Comme régulièrement avec Artifex Mundi, il est de qualité, du moins pour les standards de ce genre de jeu. La durée de vie est courte mais cohérente avec le côté "casual" du soft (4 heures). Il vaut mieux comme souvent jouer directement en Expert sinon c'est beaucoup trop facile. A noter encore les traductions vraiment approximatives... pour un jeu où les noms des objets est pourtant important il me semble... mais bon... Même si je n'ai pas totalement accroché avec l'histoire, l'univers m'a fait penser à BioShock ce que j'ai bien aimé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050386203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1515034713}
review: Очень интересный квест, неплохая сюжетная линия, головоломки на уровне. Эдем - довольно атмосферное место, чем-то напоминающее антураж игры "Биошок".

author: {'steamid': '76561198201178622', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1515178653}
review:
Obviously, as this is an Artifex Mundi game, it'ss going to get a recommend. Beore they gave up on the genre, AF was the pinnacle of HOG gaming. This game is no exception.

I have two major complaints, however. The first is a story issue. Eden is a very interesting idea that was kept vague, even in the bonus story. As I (and likely a large percentage of others who will play this) have never played Bioshock, the reports of numerous references do little to explain the backstory of Eden. Some scattered notes describing its history would have been nice.

The second complaint iss a mechanical one. You get a lovely map at the very beginning, but there is no fast-travel. This isn't so bad in games where you explore small areas at a time, but for one where you must travel across the map and deal with elevator animations each time you change floors, the lack of uch a mechanic makes things more tedious.

Beyond these points, however, the game is rrather enjoyable and the puzzles are fairly simple, making it a great choice for casual gamers. The plotline also has some elements that aren't often explored, even if the main goal is rather cliché.

review:

有中文很好，翻译质量也不错。但找物品小游戏的翻译简直了。。。举个例子：要你找个泉水，看了半天也找不到，发现角落里有个弹簧，我想会不会是找弹簧？两个都是spring。。。果然，感谢您没让我找春天，谢谢了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198192189983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1499209713}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965404642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1505856005}
review:
Un jeu de puzzles et d'objets cachés très sympathique.
Les graphismes et les couleurs sont jolis, les traductions sont correctes et l'histoire prenante, même si je n'ai pas aimé la fin.
Pour ce qui est de la difficulté, c'est asser simple avec une ou deux énigmes qui sont plus corsées mais sans plus. En revanche, après la moitié de l'histoire, les aller et retour pour naviguer dans le monde sont trop présents, il n'y a plus de linéarité et c'est plus un jeu de ballade and click qu'un jeu d'aventure puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011340401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1700555525}
review:
Story and scenery:
A rather short story, and although it's a bit of fun to detect all the references to bioshock (especially in the first couple of hours),it's all a bit too humourless and bland. 
That said, it's still Artifex Mundi, so the presentation and is more than ok.
For example the scene with the bridge is viewable from the elevator. Depending at which point in the story you see this, this view alters.For a simple hog this betrays an uncommon attention to detail.

Hidden object : 
You're given words and try to find the pictures. They're very easy and as english isn't my native language, I always pick up a word or two from these kind of games. They're very (too ?) easy and as usual in an AM-game they can be changed into a mahjong-board.

Puzzles : Now and then you'll need a couple of tries but they're mostly very easy (again, too easy ?) and fortunately no sliding puzzle in sight.

There are no secrets to find and the extra's let you have the standard stuff (wallpaper, music, cut-scenes, etc...). All in all, not the best AM-game I played but decent enough to warrant an upvote.

review:

if you see it on steam sale for cheap I reccomend grabbing it even if you cant play it right away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068235410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1511481498}
review:
50번째 완전정복 게임


포인트 앤 클릭류의 명가 Artifex Mundi 의 게임입니다

심해 테마의 미스터리한 비밀을 파헤치며 잃어버린 배우자를 찾는 주인공의 이야기 입니다

+ 괜찮은 연출
+ 너무 쉽지도 어렵지도 않은 퍼즐 난이도
+ 한편의 영화를 보는듯한 스토리
+ 적당한 분량

- 개연성 없는 숨은그림찾기
- 똥개 훈련 시키는 아이템 찾기
- 엘레베이터 좀!!!!!
- 알수없는 숨은그림찾기 번역

2회차+@로 모든 업적 달성이 가능합니다. 게임 플레이 중 제일 짜증 났던건 엘레베이터 조작이었네요.. 아이템 하나 먹자고 왔다갔다 시키는것도 짜증나는데 잘못 클릭하면 또 엘레베이터 다시 타야 되는 번거로움..

번역의 경우, 스토리 이해에는 전혀 문제가 없지만 가끔 오타가 있긴 한데, 좀 심하다 싶은 경우는 숨은그림찾기 할 때 입니다.
당최 무슨 물건을 말하는지 몰라서 찾기가 힘든 경우가 몇개 있었네요

후속 시리즈들도 앞으로 해볼만 할것 같습니다

review:
Wunderschöne phantasiereiche Unterwasserwelt
Minispiele sind manchmal etwas knifflig
Es gibt viele Überraschungsmomente
Habe mir bei Ortswechsel erstmal die tolle Umgebung mit den vielen Feinheiten angesehen. Einfach ein tolles und interessantes Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097558965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1509262110}
review: Don't expect too much. I wouldn't pay full price for this, but it was okay for the sale price. The puzzles were all really easy and a little too much of the game is just walking back and forth across the map, but even so it was relaxing and enjoyable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316163593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1510143886}
review:
Pour les Français, le jeu a été traduit avec un traducteur online. Vous devrez donc chercher un ressort quand on vous demandera de trouver "sources" , un hochet quand il y aura marqué "râle", une aiguille pour "main", une plante pour "canne" et j'en passe des tout aussi mal traduites. Pour ceux qui veulent faire le jeu en Français, quand on ne s'y attend pas, ça fait bizarre. 
Les clics sont également une plaie. Le curseur n'est pas précis, la moitié du temps il faut s'y reprendre a plusieurs fois ou aller lentement (pour certains succès de rapidité, c'est pas évident), et ça ne correspond pas toujours au visuel (par exemple, si vous déplacez un truc dans une boite, l'objet reviendra a sa place parce qu'il considèrera ne pas avoir la place de se mettre a un endroit où il devrait avoir la place selon le dessin. 
Mon temps de jeu n'est pas accurate, parce que je laisse le jeu allumer quand je vais faire autre chose (et que j'ai du le refaire pour avoir tous les succès), mais il n'est pas très long. ça aurait certainement fait un bon jeu gratuit. Mais payant, ça déçoit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976920197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1509765921}

author: {'steamid': '76561198340526397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1509720134}
review:
补充内容巨卡，放弃了。
虽然是12年的游戏可是过场画面挺不错，比很多13、14年的都好。
小游戏也比较简单，比一些其他A社的解谜游戏简单。
比较麻烦的是地图只能指示哪里有互动，不能跳转。
然后配音可能不是特别多，但比其他发行商的多。

author: {'steamid': '76561198184716029', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1584699536}
review:
解密类游戏里面算是做得很不错的了，很喜欢这个画风，可以入手，毕竟不贵。
别这样了，你好好的行吗。

你不是最好的就不是吧，反正我也不是最差的。

喜欢温柔，温柔对你来说不是什么难事。
对我来说却只敢对你。

总说撩你，我除了撩你还能做别的吗。

让你脱光光的时候，你才是你自己。

想你是个妓女也好，就算倾家荡产也要找你夜夜笙歌。

你想过在哪里跟我干一架？
阳台？浴缸？还是车里。

沉迷于女色和沉迷于酒精 ，都是黑色作祟。
我不一样 不喝酒 也没女人。

太随意的感情 ，一定会很随意的消失。

总的来说感情，你偷偷摸摸，我明目张胆，这就是区别。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039649734', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1509661506}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091442007', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1509504410}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056223771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1509397853}
review:
In Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden, people have moved to Eden, an underwater colony, to find freedom and enlightenment.  [spoiler] Eventually their world turned dystopian. [/spoiler]  Some time later, you find your way there on the trail of your missing fiance.  He was diving in the area and disappeared.  

Aside from the fact that bad things SHOULD happen to people dumb enough to move to the bottom of the ocean to live at the complete mercy of technology and their leaders, it's an idea that I haven't seen a game about before!  Except maybe Original X-Com, part 2.  In any case, you show up and are there to solve all the problems that these potential cultists find themselves amidst.

This is where everything gets sort of ... meh.  The graphics are average and the writing seems ... bland.  The voice acting and puzzles are completely underwhelming.  They try to liven things up with some jump-scares, but these scenes are mildly amusing rather than scary.  Oh, and there is walking ... lots and lots and lots of walking ... back and forth  ... to and fro ... taking objects from one corner of the map to another, only to have to return.  

Also, you will have to do all this twice to get all the achievements, as the dominos and hidden object scenes are mutually exclusive.

Not great, not awful.  It's just a run-of-the-mill HOG.  There are much worse ways that I have spent 4 hours, so I'll recommend it, but only slightly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002530309', 'num_games_owned': 2671, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1509457392}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1561648528}
review:
Definitely one of my favorite hidden object games. The team that puts these together really knows the genre. They have top notch UI polish, and their puzzles in expert mode are the perfect difficulty - challenging without being frustrating. A relaxing brain workout and attention-grabber.

The plot is actually quite fun - sort of a mashup of Lovecraft and BioShock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372064534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1508622663}
review:
This game is... well, yes... i think it is awesome. It is Artifex Mundi and it is NOT a fluffy pink everything will be great game. 

When I saw the starting video, I wasn't sure about the kind of the game. Honestly, I thought, it would really suck. But it got a chance-and I am glad I did it. After ten minutes I couldn't stop playing because I wanted to know, how the story would go on. The game itself is a little bit more tricky than others but I liked this more, too. The story... well, everything I would say would be a spoiler. Just do yourself a favor and don't do too much research on the game because it lives from the surprising things. I hope you enjoy it as much as i did. i can highly recommend it. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057456440', 'num_games_owned': 2617, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1456509960}
review:
邦題『アビス：エデンの怒り』

一見バイオショックかと思うような世界観のアイテム探しゲーム。
標準で日本語化あり。
アドベンチャー色が強く、アイテム探しパートよりもパズルパートの方に力を入れている感じ。
この手のゲームは、日本語化されていると逆に難易度が下がりすぎて微妙なところ。
また、たまに日本語訳が違っており、目的のアイテムを見つけることが困難な場合があります。
つまり、誤訳を予測して見つける能力が問われているというわけですｗ

それはともかく、完成度は高くアドベンチャーとして十分楽しめます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1407913995}
review:
A visually appealing hidden object (or dominos if you prefer) game with an interesting story. 
Unfortunately getting 100% achievements requires two playthroughs.
Worth playing if you enjoy this type of game, but not worth it for achievement hunters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267393126', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1506777893}
review:
I genuinely did want to like this game, but considering the price and what you get, I can't

The art is good, the story is good, the characters are okay, but the mechanic turn what could have been a perfectly fine HOG into a tedious and annoying slog for achievements

Not to mention how much I hate the general idea of forcing people to play the game again on expert difficulty (which I do anyway, but is bullshit for people who get this expecting a casual game), but also having to play it through twice in order to get the achievements for BOTH puzzle options, HOG or Domino, which is just redundant and unnecessary. I like achievements in games, but they should feel like achievements, not like I've just removed a fingernail everytime I complete one

Not to mention the backtracking, now I don't mind being made to go back and find things, but this games map is idiotic, with the elevator being the worst of it. What kind of stupid engineer decided to have this elevator stop at every damn floor? You wanna make a convoluted map? Fine. But give the option to shortcut to different areas. If you're FORCING me to bounce between two levels to complete this game, then don't make it a damn chore to do so

Get it on sale or in a bundle, otherwise it's not worth it. Took me about 10 hours to finish this game with all achievements and I feel like I need to apologise to my mother for wasting this life she gave me

author: {'steamid': '76561198355961063', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1506705358}
review:
在众多Artifex的寻物游戏中，我还是不推荐这一款了。

本作与其余寻物游戏相比，道具的前后关联度高，地图较为统一，并非跟随剧情线性跑过地图，而是要来回收集物品，这一点是加分项。

减分项如下：1.没有收集要素，所以全程跟着地图提示走即可，没有可探索性。
                     2.剧情中有电梯，乘坐电梯会有不短的一段过场动画。但本作并没有瞬移，在此经常会耽误。
                     3.额外内容出现了bug，每次进入寻物谜题都会掉帧。
                     4.成就系统要求至少两周目，而且如果出现差错不能直接重来，必须通关这一周目才行

至于剧情虎头蛇尾对于寻物游戏来说是通病，故并不苛求。但整个游戏过程不能说享受，反而因为不顺畅所以会有点心烦。因此不推荐

author: {'steamid': '76561198030464920', 'num_games_owned': 2774, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1506722734}
review:
Güzel grafikli bir tıklama,gizli nesne bulma oyunu.Enigma kadar sarmadı ama bu da fena değil.Farklı bulmacalar var.Haritada ışınlanma yok.Başarımların hepsi yapılabilir çok zor değil.Su altı hissini bana pek yaşatmadı doyasıya.Etkisi altına alamadı yani.Onun dışında tepki olarak ekranı sallama var ve bazıları çok gerekmez olmuş yerine göre ve bana göre de malcaydı.Anca indirimde alınıp oynanabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1506715489}
review:
“Abyss The Wraiths of Eden” una interesante aventura acuática de búsqueda de objetos, que presenta muchos puzles, que ya se ha visto en otros juegos de Artifex Mundi. La historia tiene connotaciones oscuras, la cual se cuenta en un castellano subtitulado lleno de erratas. Cuyos errores ortográficos, provocan que no sepamos muchas veces, que estamos buscando entre los objetos.
También sorprende, que no leamos palabras de un español neutro, si no, de un español latinoamericano, lo que dificulta bastante el entendimiento, para saber que buscar.
Lamentablemente, todos sus logros, siguen siendo solo accesibles, a través de la jugabilidad de su modo historia principal, por lo que olvídate de obtenerlo desde el menú de acceso a los puzles de “Busqueda de Objetos” o la aventura adicional.
Ofrece variedad de extras, y como ya mencione antes, una ampliación de la aventura, protagonizado sorprendentemente por un hombre. 
Lo que hay que reconocerles, son las secuencias de video, que están bien trabajadas.
Aun tras mi critica, lo recomiendo, porque el juego merece la pena. 
Si lo compras, adquiérelo solo por 1€, si lo encuentras formando parte de algún bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116649728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1506517092}
review:
[h1]Abyss The Wraiths of Eden - игра в жанре point-click ,в которой  набор головоломок объединённых единым мистическим сюжетом и приятной рисовкой.[/h1]

Сюжет игры не замысловат, но разработчики и не нацелена на лавры Тима Шефера. В игре повествуется история о дайверах, что отправились на исследования морского дна и наткнулись на нечто странное. Сначала пропадает парень и главная героиня отправляется на его поиски. Впереди её ждут исследования морского дна, утонувшего корабля и других почивших в пучине объектов, а судьба сведёт героиню с морскими монстрами, призраками и порабощёнными древним злом людьми. Кинематографические вставки хорошо сделанные и атмосферные, за ними действительно интересно следить.

Головоломок много: от подобия маджонга и до классического поиска предметов. Все они не сложные, всё интуитивно понятно, но порой придётся пораскинуть мозгами. Для совсем уж ленивых людей, которые играют только ради сюжета, есть подсказки. Но пользоваться подсказками в этой игре даже стыдно что ли. Лично меня игра никогда не ставила в тупик, да и жанр квестов я люблю, так что подсказки - для слабаков. 
Также радует дневник героини, где можно посмотреть цели, которые нужно достичь, а также небольшие заметки о мире игры и происходящем. 

Музыка и звуки в игре хороши, они порой не плохо нагнетают атмосферу. Конечно не дотягивают до игр ААА класса, но для своего сегмента - просто шикарно.
Графика в игре радует, рисунки сделаны с душой и явно без халтуры: все эти подводные пейзажи - завораживают, художники уделили много внимания деталям и локации не выглядят пустыми, а наоборот, веришь, что это живой мир. 
В игре всё интуитивно понятно: Хочешь перейти в локацию слева - нажми на левый край картинки, хочешь провернуть ручку сейфа - нажми на ручку (даже для тех кто никогда не играл в квесты разобраться во всём этом не составит труда).

[i]За "Abyss The Wraiths of Eden" приятно скоротать пару вечеров за решением головоломок, так что рекомендую всем отключиться от взрывов, убийств и крови и расслабиться вечером перед компьютером за этой игрой.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1611668074}
review:
This is a routine point and click hidden object puzzle game.  It's got widescreen support and looks decent on a modern PC, so you don't get distracted by technical failings/distorted aspect ratios/pillarboxing.

A very casual game and not everyone's cup of tea but if you like this sort of thing it's one of the better examples.  Unfortunately the developer wants $14.50 for the privilege of playing this mobile port on PC, when they give it away free to mobile gamers.  Screw those guys for having such disrespect for PC gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331729581', 'num_games_owned': 2502, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1500953006}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999929185', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1642857454}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden

Typisch Wimmelbild Spiel von dem Polnischen Entwickler Artifex Mundi

Die Hauptaufgabe Rätsel lösen.
Dafür erlebst du ein besonderes spannendes Abenteuer bei dem du die schön dargestellte Unterwasserwelt genießen kannst.
Wenn du mal nicht weiter weißt, weil die Rätsel zu schwierig sind, wird dir natürlich intern im Spiel auf die Sprünge geholfen.

Das Spiel ist in 7 Kapitel unterteilt 

Prolog: Das Wrack

1. Kapitel Eden – 2. Ebene
2. Kapitel Hotel Albion
3. Kapitel Unterste Ebene
4. Kapitel Das  Gegenmittel
5. Kapitel Schacht 3
6. Kapitel Das Ritual
7. Das letzte Kapitel

author: {'steamid': '76561198077907555', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1504562507}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1503343662}
review:
One more of the traditional Artifex Mundi hidden object adventures with a considerably challenging extra.

Your fiancé Robet was last seen in an underwater expedition, in which he found a mysterious underground facility. To rescue him, you need fo venture in the facility while avoiding the bizarre Legates, who seem to be plotting something. Like the other titles from this producer (such as the Nightmares from the Deep series), you will need to solve Hidden Object puzzles and some other Minigames in order to collect items which will allow you to proceed the story. The Hidden Object puzzles can be freely swapped by a form of a Domino game. In my opinion, the Domino games are particularly disappointing and dull, however. The game also allows you to choose a difficulty too, between Casual and Expert.

The flow of the puzzles is good and most of the things feel logical. There is no "pixel hunting" as some other games of the genre, which is definitely a plus. The art is pretty, but sadly the whole game is in low-res. Fullscreen will just stretch it out.

Now, the extra chapter was a bit of a surprise. Its minigames are far more challenging than those of the regular game and was definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135403043', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1501955803}
review:
[h1]類型：[/h1]
點擊互動式劇情解謎
[h1]要素：[/h1]
收集品，物品組合(尋物解謎時)，尋物，解謎，氛圍，懸疑
[h1]中文：[/h1]
官方中文，對話大致正確，尋物及解謎少部分翻譯有誤，例如破的鏡子翻成壞運氣。還有場景"接待處"上方寫一個堅固的金屬擋住去路，結果卻能拿小刀劃開，那明明只是塊布...
[h1]劇情：[/h1]
一般。劇情整體略短。雖然故事的起伏轉折不多，但整個事件的起源我倒是沒猜到，還蠻讓我意外的！
[h1]畫面：[/h1]
一般。畫面豐富度還不錯，氣氛也可以。但由於是2012年的遊戲，畫面和近期的解謎遊戲相比，較不細緻，不到做壁紙的程度
[h1]音效：[/h1]
一般。音樂不夠豐富，音效到位，人物對話情感有表現出來
[h1]難度：[/h1]
一般。尋物及益智解謎部分算簡單，主要難度在於，要通往下個劇情的關鍵，往往分散在很多場景，玩家得花很多時間來回找。若參考地圖會較容易
[h1]操作：[/h1]
簡單
[h1]優化：[/h1]
順暢
[h1] 娛樂：[/h1]
低。娛樂性在於部分解謎設計不錯，頗動腦，但本作的解謎謎題不多，幾乎都是到處走路找東西（最後的亮光解謎真的有難度）。劇情主軸也還可以。但遺憾的是～劇情的推進得玩家頻繁的搭電梯在各個場景當工具人！使得整體故事失去流暢度。若能隨著劇情發展，將解謎及物品控制在區域內，而不是搭電梯往前又往後的到處繞，或許對於玩家的遊玩體驗會較好，畢竟這是個帶有劇情的解謎遊戲，不是個走來走去的工具人遊戲。
[h1]重玩：[/h1]
無
[h1] 入手價格：[/h1]
－８０％，NT＄５８
[h1]總結：[/h1]
[u][h1][b]個人不推薦，原因是劇情的帶入感和解謎的趣味，完全被繁複的拿物品到處繞所掩蓋，尤其遊戲中又有設計地圖，為何不讓玩家能直接傳送切換場景，實在是用走路來換取玩家遊玩時間...。但由於個人是－８０％特價時購買的，價格太便宜。若喜好解謎的玩家有閒錢，對於頻繁繞重複場景的忍耐度高，那可以買來體驗一下[/b][/h1][/u]

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
１。少部分物品翻譯有誤及場景說明有問題
２。人物動畫時，臉部說話表情非常怪異（下巴），好像木偶人
３。整體劇情略短（故事大綱不錯），太多時間是耗在搭電梯於各場景間來來回回走動拿東西，導致解謎的流暢度不好
４。解析度無法調整，畫面不精緻
[h1]５。設計了地圖，為甚麼不能傳送場景啊！要走來走去才有真實感嗎？[/h1]

[h1]優點：[/h1]
１。打折時價格便宜
２。有中文就是讚
[h1]３。有地圖可參考，能幫助確認還有哪些未解開的謎題，非常好的設計[/h1]

[h1]分享：[/h1]
１。本作的場景較為開放，所以許多解謎在尚未拿到解謎的關鍵時，是無法開啟觸發。必須隨著劇情正確的推進，才能進行。所以若有卡住的情況，可以參考地圖往之前的場景，找找是否有尋物解謎，或者點擊尚未完成並且有放大鏡的物品
２。劇情之後會拿到地圖，位於左下角菜單旁，能夠確認還有那些謎團

[h1]畫面真的還好...[/h1]
[url]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1101379703[/url]

[h1]其餘附圖請參考網址[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198135403043/screenshots/

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1451911981}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is a puzzle game from publisher Artifex Mundi. The story asks you to explore a sunken city while destroying the evil hiding in this remote, underwater area.

The game provide hidden object scenes and various mini-games as puzzles, its all the usual, cant think about any special mini-game i not seen in any other HoG. Hidden object scenes could be finished by playing domino.

Just like in all Artifex Mundi games, the artwork is beautiful, the cutscenes and voice acting enjoyable. 

If you like these kind of games you will definetly enjoy this as much as i enjoyed it. Worth its price, but there are so many sales out there each year..... you can always wait for one.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill share some informations about achievements:
20 steam achievements available. Just like for all these games, you need a playthrough without hint/skip. 2 playthroughs required, in one you need finish hidden objects scenes, in other one you need finish them via dominos. One of the playthrough should be on expert difficulty. You need finish 1 domino and 1 hidden obejct game too, each in less than 1minutes, so i suggest domino walkthrough for expert so you can spamclick hidden object scene on normal for the 1min speed achievement. Finishing bonus contect once also required for perfecting the game.
Time to 100%: 8-9h

author: {'steamid': '76561198001960104', 'num_games_owned': 1833, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1499549104}
review:
So, Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is not a bad game in itself. It is certainly a decently made hidden-object game, with plenty of nice illustrations and the riddles are okay as well. That is, however, where the good points end already. The story is meh, the animated sequences are worse and riddled with clipping errors, and the voice-acting is, well, not really deserving of the term "acting". And in order to obtain all achievements you have to play through the whole slog at least twice (ideally once for all the hidden-object scenes and once for their domino-based alternatives). At least you can go through it for a second time rather quickly, as skipping the animations and talk parts is possible in most cases and without them the game is actually rather short (roughly 3 hours).

So, while I won't completely condemn this game, I'd say get it only if you're a fan of the genre and don't care too much about decent storytelling and acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971048113', 'num_games_owned': 10059, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1500733661}
review: Pretty good story which is all that really matters here. Like other reviews have mentioned, it borrows stuff from several sources. Puzzles and hidden object scenes were solid. Recommended if you can get it for a good discount or from a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115984362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1500439370}
review: For a casual game, this one really tries to go above and beyond what's standard. There's a decent attempt at a story that's actually fairly interesting. It borrows a LOT of elements from Bioshock, especially in the aesthetic, as well as Lovecraft. The story and jump scares were all fairly predictable but it was fun nonetheless. The voice acting and dialog are really bad though to the point where it can be pretty funny. The animation and visual design were really appealing, but rips off many better things. Overall, though, pretty good game. I bought it on sale recently and probably wouldn't buy it for the full listed price. It's definitely not a $10 game, but if you can get it on sale, I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062030709', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1500430706}
review:
[h1]This review will not cover the whole game, [i]yet.*[/i][/h1]

So far, I've really enjoyed the story within Abyss, and I've admired the artwork as well. While seemingly graphically mediocre, it still seems nice. It's obviously not the best looking game, but it still looks good. *I would really like to complete the game some day, but right now there are other games on sale that I know I'd play a lot more often than this game, so I'll be refunding it, [i]for now.*[/i] So far though, it's got a decent story, decent graphics, standard "hidden object/point & Click" gameplay, and it's at a decent price, and frequently on sale due to it's age and gametype, so I really would recommend you at least try it. There's always the refund option if you don't like it, or think you'd rather spend the same money on another title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119319611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1500140091}
review: The Wraiths of Rapture. The world felt like it took place in BioShock. The atmosphere was fine, the graphics were nice. The puzzles were good, but the hidden object games were too easy (and they were lagging for me during the bonus content). Also, I couldn't always see the reasons behind them. For example, [spoiler]during the bonus, I had to find something, which is okay. But the guy's wife was kidnapped, I thought he would be in a hurry, he only had to grab some small thing, not to paint a plank red, just because the item list told him so. Anyway, he didn't have to use that plank at all, but at least it was painted red. Yay, I guess. Good reason to keep his wife waiting. [/spoiler]The soundtrack is repetitive after a time. The jump scares were a bit lame, the plot showed nothing new, but it wasn't bad, I just didn't care about anyone. All in all, the game is not good or bad, just simply meh. Buy it on sale, if you are interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300270231', 'num_games_owned': 5385, 'num_reviews': 894, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1499617693}
review:
사라진 연인을 찾기 위한 여인의 파란만장한 어드벤쳐 러브 스토리 [b]《심연: 에덴의 유령》[/b]입니다. 포인트&클릭 장르의 명가 아티팩스 문디의 기술력은 2012년도에도 아주 건재했었다는 걸 알 수 있었습니다. 약간 나쁘게 말하자면, 예나 지금이나 발전된 모습 없이 그대로라고 할 수 있겠네요. 뭐, 그 '그대로' 가 괜찮다는 사실에는 변함이 없다는 게 중요한 것이겠죠.

 + 완벽 한글화로 스토리에 몰입감을 더해준다
 + 매끄러운 진행
 + 퍼즐의 난이도가 대체로 쉬운 편이다
 + 그레고리의 과거를 알 수 있는 보너스 컨텐츠 존재
 + 풍부한 사운드 및 효과음
 + 자연스러운 성우진들의 연기
 + 도전과제 올클리어가 어렵지 않다
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(플탐 대비 파밍시간 적절)

 - 지도에서 바로가기 기능이 없어서 이동하는데 약간 귀찮다
 - 도전과제 올클리어를 위해서 회차반복이 필요하다

 아티팩스 문디 스타일의 포인트&클릭 게임은 정말 '한글화'가 큰 장점입니다. 이것 때문에 영어를 잘 못하는 유저도 마냥 포인트를 갈겨서 진행하는 게 아닌, 스토리를 이해하면서 게임을 즐길 수가 있는 것이죠. 아티팩스 문디의 또 다른 시리즈는 과연 어떤 이야기를 담고 있을지 항상 기대가 되네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004204403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1494795740}
review: Giudizio negativo. La Artifex Mundi ha sicuramente prodotto titoli migliori di questo. La trama è soporifera nonostante ce la mettano tutta per creare della suspance (???). Per assurdo ho trovato più interessante il breve capitolo dedicato a Laura e Greg (prequel della storia) sbloccabile una volta finito il gioco. Le sezioni hidden objects sono usate due volte nel proseguio della storia: la seconda viene riciclata al netto dei 16 oggetti già trovati la prima volta, rendendo il compito ancor più semplice. Le traduzioni fatte con Gxxgle sono imbarazzanti, rendendo molto spesso impossibile trovare l'oggetto richiesto poichè mal tradotto, obbligandoci a cliccare su tutto a caso (addio relativi achievements!). Finito in 6 orette, anche i rompicapo sono piuttosto banali (ne ho trovato giusto due originali). Sappiate che sono un maniaco degli achievements ed averlo disinstallato non appena finita la storia, senza rigiocarla mirando agli achievements mancanti, dovrebbe dirla lunga!! Bocciato - ci sono alternative più valide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120712540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1495329194}
review: I would love to say this is just as good as all the other titals this company puts out but it isn't. It crashes on my Mac through about half the cut seens and I have to skip them to keep playing. I have a general idea what the story is but thats where the 4 hours game play is comeing from.  There is a lot of back and forth, but at least most games I've played have a way to just skip to the sceen you want to be on. And if anything moves. I've yet to finish this one, and to be honist, the first time it crashes on me with the extra content I'm going to say fuck it. I would have returned it if I had realized, with trying to make it work I'd hit 2 hours. I wish they had show this one as much love as any of thier other titals. This genre needs all the help it can get and putting out a buggy mess like this dosn't help. If your playing with a Mac then don't get it unless its way cheep. Like 70% or more cheep.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050552857', 'num_games_owned': 2290, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1418377768}
review:
바이오쇼크를 생각나게 하는 어드벤처 게임 

+ 영화같은 연출을 통한 몰입감 높은 게임 진행 
+ 막히는 부분없이 빠르게 진행하게 해주는 힌트 시스템 
+ 공식 한글화 

- 2회차 부터 급격히 하락하는 재미 
- 난이도 차이가 별로 없는 고급 모드와 전문가 모드 
- 한번 시작하면 중간에 처음부터 다시 시작 할 수가 없는 점 

리뷰 점수: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198329812881', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1559013453}
review:
* Первый час играть интересно, но потом бродить туда-сюда надоедает, а ведь придётся делать это всю игру.
Если первое время графика не режет глаз, то через некоторое время - это начнётся. Игра попросту не пугает, а смешит! . Но когда начинаются диалоги... Персонажи не моргают, их рот открывается как-то странно, а их лица пугают больше, чем скримеры в этой игре. Геймлей же обычный для квеста и "найди предмет". 

 * Игра выдыхается очень быстро, когда до конца ещё пару часов... Плохая графика, сюжет интересен до половины игры, спасибо за это скитаниям туда-сюда.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058239466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1494511827}
review:
Из игр подобного жанра (поиск предметов) играл только в Hero of the Kingdom, поэтому при прохождении Abyss сравнивал именно с этой серией.
Жутко бесит "прыгание" между основным отображением локации и её отдельных зон ради 1-2 предметов и невозможность взять предмет "впрок" (чтобы взять крюк надо сначала найти веревку и т.п.). Как следствие, постоянные перемещения между маленькими локациями ради 1-2 предметов. Зачем нужна карта, если быстрого перехода между локациями нет? В итоге треть времени игры - это повторяющаяся анимация перемещений.
По сюжету: всё прямолинейно, если есть повороты, то они ожидаемы (если в кармане всё ещё лежат какие-то фишки, а нам предлагают прям сейчас уплыть на подлодке, то 100%, что уплыть не получится)). Немного напрягает, что с момента захвата Эдема Легатами прошло не более 15 лет (возраст девочки + пара лет), а до этого он существовал всего 10 лет (где-то на плакате было), но всё подаётся так, будто про Эдем уже давным-давно забыли и сейчас внезапно обнаружили.
P.S. Хотел получить все достижения, ради чего второй раз пробежался на сложности "эксперт" - игра мне этого не засчитала и двух достижений (прохождение на эксперте и коллекционер) не дала.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009393197', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1493035363}
review:
I recommend this if you get it cheap or as part of a bundle, otherwise avoid.

[u]The good[/u]

Puzzles and some of the HO scenes are a challenge
Dominoes is a great alternative to doing HOs
Crisp, clean visuals

[u]The bad[/u]

Annoying, repetitive music
Terrible voice acting
Lag in some HO scenes
Plenty of tiresome backtracking, going up and down that elevator
Story is a partial ripoff of Bioshock
Minimal replay value

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1492576400}
review:
https://youtu.be/djC4SluboJM

A typical hidden object game with a variety of minor puzzles to change up the experience from moment to moment.  Many of the classic tropes continue to be frustrating, especially throwing away items after a single use, but that's why it's a trope.

The underwater city setting works pretty well but is a little reminiscent of other specific games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1490875925}
review:
Abysse : Les Spectres d'Eden est comme tous les jeux d'objets cachés réalisés par Artifex Mundi : il fait partie des meilleurs du genre.

La difficulté est naturellement peu élevée, même en Mode Expert, mais conforme à ce qu'on peut attendre d'un jeu de ce genre et mais la partie reste plaisante et accessible à tous.

Evidemment, il y a parfois des aberrations dans la gestion des objets (les outils qu'on ne peut utiliser qu'une seule fois alors qu'ils seraient utiles plusieurs fois dans l'aventure) mais c'est assez coutumier dans ce genre de jeu.

Finalement, ce qui est le plus gênant est peut-être la traduction française parfois plus que fantaisiste, surtout dans les listes d'objets à chercher.


Bref, Artifex Mundi a sorti là en 2012 un des premiers jeux qui a fait depuis sa réputation et les amateurs d'objets cachés peuvent y aller les yeux fermés. Mais bien évidemment pas au prix original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048067132', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1489019841}
review:
Für ein Wimmelbild Spiel okay aber nicht für 8€ (Habe von einem Freund als Scherz geschänkt bekommen der es aus einem Pack hatte).
Die Story ist Standard, mystischer Ort, Böse Dämonen und Unlogische Rätsel. Die EINE Person die alles Weiß und alles kann.

Die so nett formulierten "Hochwertigen" Zwischensequenzen sind mehr schlecht als "Hochwertig", keine fliesenden Bewegungen mehr eine Stop-motion "Unterhaltung". Aber auch ehr Standard für ein Wimmelbild Spiel.

Knapp 3 stunden Spielzeit auf einfach sind zu wenig, ich bin kein typischer Wimmelbild Spieler und dieses war mein erstes seit Jahren und denn noch bin ich quasi durch gerannt weil es alles zu vorhersehbar war.

Viel mehr kann und brauche ich auch nicht dazu sagen.
Wer Wimmelbild Spiele mag kann es sich getrost geben aber sollte evtl. auf ein Angebot warten oder es sich anderweitig besorgen.

Grüße
Der Link

review: So far, one of the best Artifex Mundi's game. Maybe the story isn't original, but it's nice. I like the pace,  backgrounds, puzzles, music. Characters are well defined. You can't control the elevator properly though, so you must stop at every floor every time, it's boring. If you play the italian version, you need a LOT of imagination (subtitles and hidden objects)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046065881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1488430324}
review:
I thought this story had a lot of potential. But unfortunately, the Buzz Killington characters ended up slowly sucking the life out of it over the course of the game. The wraiths turn out to be more awkwardly annoying than menacing and both protagonists nearly put me to sleep. I will say however, the protagonists do turn out to be perfect for each other as both have personality traits reminiscent of vanilla ice cream without the vanilla flavoring. Although they used all the right words to convey drama, the voice acting just didn't bring it. How they managed to convey such a consistent, underlying dial tone of emotional nothingness in such an extreme situation is still a mystery to me. Perhaps that's the "Abyss" the developers are referring to in the game's title? 

Although the graphics and cutscenes were crisp, I thought the art (although conceptually interesting enough) looked a little lazy compared to similar games of this type - or maybe that has more to do with it being from 2012 - or maybe that's a style choice and part of it's charm - dunno? The hidden object puzzles' difficulty was about average and the mini games were standard fare. The gameplay itself was fine. I especially liked being able to harass the sea life with my clicks and the ability to hold my breath for much longer periods of time than I'm normally able. Although this game gave me sads because of what I consider lost potential, it's still a decent P&C/HOG and worth a recommend. Played well for me on Linux Mint 18.

PS I almost exclusively play offline. I typically only play online long enough for Steam to allow me to write a review. So Steam only shows that I played 0.3 hrs as of the time of this review, although I've played at least 5 hrs and have completed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185995181', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 900, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1488542444}
review:
相当出色。可以说优秀的一款解密游戏。所以我照例只说缺点：
1、汉化水平很平庸，找物游戏里有一些错误：海竿=海草，泉水=弹簧，喷泉=鲸鱼喷水等；
2、地图没有移动功能，老是要经过电梯挺烦人的；
3、物品栏无法锁定（这是老毛病了）；
4、谜题类型还是非常简单和大众化。没有什么新意；
最重要的一点是，男主长的实在是比较抱歉，结局的时候那段感情戏让我快吐了。。。
