author: {'steamid': '76561198161279682', 'num_games_owned': 1731, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1488153108}
review:
Un juego para los amantes de los rompecabezas. Lo q más destaco de este juego (a diferencia de la mayoría de los juegos de este estilo), q es prácticamente imposible q te quedes atascado porque no encontraste una pieza q estaba en la esquina inferior de la pantalla o algo similar. Las cosas tienen sentido, si no te sale algo puedes usar pistas, pero completé el juego sin necesitarlo y en modo experto, claro me tardé más en pensar las cosas pero se hace más divertido.

En resumen, de los mejores en su género.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980376608', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1488112180}
review:
"Найдите пропавшую без вести невесту в таинственном подводном городе", - вещают нам в описании игры. Хм, а искать-то придется мужика! Впрочем, настолько славащового и беспомощного, что его вполне можно назвать... невестой. Естественно, если вы ищете пропавшего без вести инфантила под водой(!), то на дне обнаружится целое посление умалишенцев, организовавших Биошок для самых маленьких. Вместо Восторга - Эдем, а поехавшего Эндрю Райана замещает демон с хроническим конъюнктивитом. 

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden почти изящно балансирует на грани казуалки point-n-click и полноценного квеста, клишированности и оригинальности, красивой графики и безобразной, так никуда и не скатившись. Чудеса эквилибристики. Зубодробительного нет НИЧЕГО. Хорошо это или плохо сложно сказать. Конечно, игра, которую без солюшенов даже под грибами не пройдешь, это не очень хорошо. Но когда нет ни одной загадки, чтоб хотя бы минут двадцать помучиться над ее решением, это тоже как-то не айс. Зато нет никакого бреда для экстрасенсов (вроде такого - чтобы открыть красную дверь, надо побрить синего паука зеленой стамеской. От страха он пукнет желтым ключем - вот им и откроется). Не, тут такого нет и слава Нептуну. Все настолько на поверхности, что порой даже противно. 

Мне игра досталась нахаляву, поэтому говорить об оправданности цены в 200 рублей с водорослями сложно. В целом, мне показалось, что все совсем недурно. Я даже ради ачивок ее два раза прошел - выбил все без напряга. Карточки к тому же выпали. Рупь/ведро, конечно, но в тему :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032089697', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1487630381}
review:
I am starting to become addicted to these things, these hidden object adventure puzzlers. Maybe its because I’m an old fart, and tiring of the blood and gore of my staples like Fallout and GTA. Or is it because Artifex Mundi actually know how to make a great adventure game, one that at times rivals those of Lucas Arts, such classics as Monkey Island, Loom or Day of the Tentacles. 

Story
You play an unnamed female who is in search of her boyfriend Robert, a dashing nautical researcher (I like my men without beards, thank you) who happens to disappear while investigating a supposedly abandoned underwater city called Eden.

In your travels to find Mr Right-half-the-time, you find survivors of the failed aquatic utopia, who are trying to fight a mysterious ancient evil (Look, it’s George Burns!), that was accidentally awakened during construction of new extensions to the city. In the end it’s a typical save the city, get the guy kind of thing (though he needs to be taller, I like my men taller please).

Game Play
Abyss: The Wraith of Eden is still predominately hidden object puzzles but there is a bigger smattering of actual brain teasers that keep you hooked. All the puzzles are logical and down to earth, making you feel more like MacGyver, than mind destroying abstract art-ish ones that need you to take an acid trip just to understand them. 

Example, while exploring a submerged room for something to snip some fence wire, I found a toolbox, ‘Excellent’ I thought. Nope, all the tools are broken into pieces and buried under mud and silt. WTF!!!!!, then I investigated the room further and found a hidden metal detector, hoorah! Use the detector to find the parts for a pair of pliers and your done.

Most of the game will have you going back and forth throughout the city, so to solve a puzzle in one room, will sometimes need items collected from either the next or previous rooms, or somewhere else in the complex. This can get you a little lost in you objectives, but thankfully Artifex Mundi threw in a map that keeps you on track and helps you find your way around.

Even the hidden object puzzles are no longer just random useless garbage that you need to find for the sake of finding it. Some of the items you need to advance a puzzle are lost in the pictures, so now the hidden object puzzles feel that they have a purpose to the whole story.

Everything Else
The graphics are a huge improvement over my last Artifex reviewed game, Time Mysteries: Inheritance. Granted TM:I was a remastered older game but Abyss now uses a better graphic engine, thought there are times where the cut scenes tend to look smokey and pixeled.

The voice acting has also been stepped up and gives the game more plausibility to another well written story line. The only let down this time round is the music. Most times it hits the mark and creates the right atmosphere, other times it just loses the tempo and dose not gel with the game, breaking the mood (Well, no candle lit dinner for you pal!).

Ok, so Artifex Mundi is the Mills and Boon of computer games, hey I loved the Twilight series…. Oh shite! Did I just say that out loud….. well I’m f%#&ed now, my creditability has just gone down the gurgler.

Look if you don’t mind playing female heroes, love puzzlers and a well written adventure then Abyss:- The Wraith of Eden is a must for your library. Now I must get back to putting these pink ribbons in my beard and ponytail.

Original review posted at  https://cassus.org/muut/#!/puzzle  For all your Indie gaming discussion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1485646124}
review:
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden is another hidden object game from Artifex Mundi which takes us on a journey into an underwater city, searching for our missing boyfriend (we play as a female detective as in most of these types of games). Soon we discover the tragic fate that befell the inhabitants of the city and we must find a way out before it is too late.
As a side note we also learn that the professor who leaves us clues admittedly loves riddles, so there's an actual explanation for encountering so many of them :)

Does the story seem familiar? Wouldn't be surprised if it did. 2K Games made an absolutely amazing first-person shooter in 2007 with a quite similar story and setting. Apparently Artifex Mundi drew a bit too heavily on the concept of Bioshock while making this game and it certainly shows: the Art Deco design and architecture, the flyers and even the letter formats boldly display the source where it came from. As a matter of fact there's no harm in it for me, I love the deep sea environment. The problem is with the plot: after beating the game (and the bonus chapter as well) we are still riddled with questions. What happened to the city exactly, who are these mysterious legates (/wraiths) and where did they come from, why have they been given so many privileges?
It's a shame really, because the game does a great job creating suspense and is thrilling throughout. It feels as if a little more work on the story would have helped the end result greatly.

Of course this doesn't mean the game is bad, actually there are plenty of good things around. First of all this is probably the most eventful HOG I've ever had the fortune to play with: wherever we go something always happens, changes. A warning note appears on the door, the light goes out suddenly or a corpse falls right in front of our feet! So in regard to horror, it is very similar to the previous HOG I've played, Dark Arcana: The Carnival.
Also there's a fair amount of plant horror, which would be interesting, but unfortunately we get no explanation regarding this either, so it feels like a missed opportunity. [spoiler](The vines turn people into these so called legates, but why and where did they come from?)[/spoiler]

While most of the minigames and puzzles have been seen before, they represent the good old Artifex Mundi quality, they are good and fun. The problematic ingredient of the 'twice used hidden object scenes' is present in this game as well, however this time at least these scenes are placed quite near to the target locations (where we have to use that specific item we've just gained). Maybe it's just me, but I had trouble finding some items in a few HO scenes though, some of them didn't really match their names. Also there was a puzzle in which we had to reassemble a fishbone, by putting away the obstacles that were covering the parts. Problem is, there was hardly any space for that, so I spent about 15 minutes trying to jam every unnecessary items into the corners in order to reach the fishbone pieces...
Just like in Dark Arcana: The Carnival, we can exchange the current HO with an alternative method by playing domino. In here we must play according to regular domino rules (by matching the neighboring symbols) and the goal is to reach the tree emblems.
There's another parallel with Dark Arcana: The Carnival, the lack of map travel. I don't usually use this feature, but in this game it would have been handy, as we are going to use the elevator fairly often. Although there's a point in the game where we get cornered by a [spoiler]giant octopus[/spoiler], so I can see the logic of not having it implemented, this should still be available in the rest of the game.

There's also a bonus chapter which is fairly short and shows us a snippet what Eden (the city) was like before the catastrophic events. Problem is, we get more questions instead of having answers to the already existing ones. Also the pregnant wife of Gregory caused me a slight confusion (was she carrying the twins or the girl who helps us in the main adventure?). It didn't really help the plot moving forward, so it felt a bit pointless.

The graphics is great for a hidden object game, both the graphic design (thanks to Bioshock ;)) and the realisation look great. The deep sea environments are full of details thus it's a treat to discover all the locations. The backgrounds are nicely drawn with vivid colours, the cutscenes are fluid and hardly pixellated. The sounds are above average, while the music is just mediocre, but it does help keeping up the suspense well enough.

So despite the unanswered questions that remain, the game can still be considered OK. If you like underwater scenery and are up for a ~5 hour long adventure, give it a try. And make sure you play Bioshock afterwards, if you haven't already done so :)

PROS
+ interesting (if not very original) deep sea, underwater city setting
+ plenty of minigames with alternative domino game
+ great imagery
+ thrilling cutscenes

CONS
- plot holes
- bonus chapter is lackluster
- twice used hidden object scenes

RATING
6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198134847821', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1485877395}
review:
[h1] Тайна, скрытая в глубине океана.[/h1] 

Довольно таки интересная приключенческая игра с поиском предметом. Завораживающий сюжет со сделанной хорошей визуализацией. 
Сюжет. Главная героиня этой игры ищет мужа, который пропал где то в океане. Идя по следу, она находит мистический Эдэм - город, спрятаный под водой. Запустевший, но не безлюдный и довольно мрачный.
Геймплей сводится к поиску предметов, как к мини играм, так и по сюжету. Классическая адвенчура, разбавленная головоломками разных видов простыми и интересными. А в мини игре "найти предметы", есть игра "домино", которая может облегчить данное прохождение.
Музыка хорошо вписалась в данную игру.

Подводя итог могу заметить схожесть этой игры с Bioshock. Может и ошибаюсь.  Данная игра подойдет всем, кому итнетерсны казуальные игры и мистика.

8,5 из 10

review: Игра замечательная, восхитительная. Погружаешься в воды океана и тебя захватывает сначала великолепная графика, а потом сюжет. Мини-игры интересные, не мозгосломные, ведь любишь разгадывать загадки, но ведь долго-то не хочешь над ними корпеть, хочется дальше пройти. И очень понравились пугалки, когда не ожидаешь этого, пару раз даже вздрогнула от неожиданности. Сейчас прохожу и не оторваться. Всем рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274101919', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1520186913}
review:
I really enjoyed this game! The story was intriguing and the mini games were not as easy and predictable as many other HO games. The graphics are very beautiful and well designed. Sometimes some scenes were surpricing so I jumped on my chair a couple of times! I'm easy to scare haha.

I really dislike though the domino alternative games. Having the choice to do the hidden objects scene OR domino game you can´t get all the achievements in one playthrough. 

Overall, I gladly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1485040148}
review:
[b][i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i][/b] is a hidden object puzzle game. Leave on a deep sea dive in search of your missing husband, only to get trapped in an underwater utopia while being tracked by ghostly beings.

[b]Pros[/b]: While the setting may appear to be a suburb of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/409710/]BioShock[/url]'s Rapture, the intrigue is fully original with mysteries and twists of its own. The hand-drawn visuals are as nice as you'd come to expect from [i]Artifex Mundi[/i], while the occasional 3D animation doesn't clash too much with the backgrounds. You'll be going back and forth throughout the complex the entire game, but it isn't too tedious as the various paths all branch out from the the same couple of rooms, so going from one location to another is never too long. The puzzles are varied enough, and while you may end up scratching your head to figure out the next step, there are very few frustrations in solving them. If you're stuck in a hidden object puzzle, you can switch to a game of domino as an alternative way to complete your objectives, giving achievement hunters replayability.

[b]Cons[/b]: The 3D animation isn't that good, and doesn't offer the same storybook feeling the hand-drawn ones give. The voice acting, while there is little of it, is someone underwhelming and feels forced. The hidden object puzzles often need to be replayed twice, giving the impression the game was being stretched too thin. While the additional content adds a few more puzzles to the game, they are way too easy and merely give uninteresting backgound information to secondary characters.

[b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - It's up to you

The story had a spooky vibe that kept me interested throughout my playthrough. It's perhaps not the most challenging game of the genre, yet Hidden Object Games aficionados will find what they were looking for. Regardless of the cons, it's a good hidden object game, and a nice way to spend a cloudy afternoon. 

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

review: And excellent take on a Bioshock-like environment under the sea.  I'm relatively new to the HOG sub-genre of adventure games, but I'll admit I like this one.  The graphics are good, the story interesting and the challenges and puzzles appear balanced.  Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078285576', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1484556445}
review: First game of Artifex Indie Gala bundle my wife and I played through. Fun hidden object, puzzles, and overall puzzle that isn't completely linear. Meh story. Terrible animation and voice acting but it's more entertaining as we're not really going for immersion on these things. About 4 hours to complete story and bonus content in the Extras menu; my wife is very fast at hidden object and I'm okay at the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992551560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1484144906}

author: {'steamid': '76561198296347139', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1483777303}
review:
Definitely recommended.

This game gives me this "discovering Atlantis" feel when it comes to the story. It's just that the Atlantis you're looking for might be much creepier and darker than you expected. In this game, the underwater city is called Eden - but without the peace. Depending on your tastes, the truth might be a bit too unrealistic. I thought it was "believable" because of the general mysticism and dark depths of the game itself. All in all, it was exciting to play and definitely (at least a bit) creepy at some points.

The visuals were simply beautiful. The colors and the details were amazing, especially the scenes in water. The murkiness brought mystery, while keeping a sense of realism - in a more enchanced way. Visually, I have nothing to complain about.

The biggest minus is the animation. I liked the voiceovers, they were full of emotion and that is what I like the most about voice acting. Unfortunately, the animation didn't stand up to the voice actors' performance. The art looks real enough, but when they start talking... The mouth movements look really mechanical. Which is a bit ironic, considering the plot of the game. Despite this, it was funny to look at and didn't truly bother me.

I enjoyed most of the minigames, especially the dominos that you can do in place of the hidden object scenes. However, if you keep switching between them, you will miss achievements. This games REQUIRES that you play the game at least twice to get every achievement. I personally find it bothersome in games, but since I really liked this one, I didn't mind this time (much).

I can fully recommend this to any HOG lover. It might be too casual to some gamers, but the expert mode should give you enough challenge so it wouldn't be boring. This yet another game I have had a physical copy of, so I knew what I was getting when I bought this. I got in on sale but I think it's not too pricy even in full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082493821', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1483422784}
review: Oyunun hikayesi güzel. Bu tarz oyunları sevenlere tavsiye edebilirim. Bu yüzden de olumlu oy kullanıyorum. Fakat ben bir süre sonra oynamaktan sıkıldım. Bir an önce bitsin istedim açıkçası.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093837561', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1593470344}
review:
Najprościej mówiąc jest to kolejna świetna produkcja polskiego studia Artifex Mundi.

[h1]OPRAWA[/H1]
Na pierwszy rzut oka widzimy śliczną, ręcznie rysowaną grafikę. Większość lokacji jest kolorowa przez co gra jak najbardziej tworzy tajemniczą atmosferę jednak nie jest ona aż tak mroczna jak w innych produkcjach Artifexu. Każde z miejsc przez nas odwiedzonych jest dopracowane w najdrobniejszych szczegółach. Wszelkie animacje są bardzo dobrze wykonane, postacie poruszają się w sposób naturalny przez co nie mamy wrażenia "sztuczności". Każdy element jest idealnie dopasowany do otoczenia co jest dowodem na to, że twórcy nie poszli na skróty i zamiast metody "kopiuj - wklej" włożyli sporo pracy aby samemu dopracować wszystkie lokacje. Muzyka oraz wszelkie efekty dźwiękowe są świetnie dobrane co sprawia, że w dużym stopniu przyczyniają się do budowy klimatu. Usłyszymy relaksujące dźwięki szumiącej wody oraz melodię, która potrafi wpaść w ucho. 

[h1]FABUŁA[/h1]
W poszukiwaniu przyjaciela trafimy do podmorskiego miasta, gdzie w niewyjaśnionych okolicznościach zniknęła większość mieszkańców. Aby ocalić towarzysza musimy rozwikłać mroczną tajemnicę tego miejsca. Na swojej drodze spotkamy kilka przyjaźnie nastawionych postaci, które pomogą nam w naszych poszukiwaniach, jednak trafimy również na zakapturzone istoty starające się za wszelką cenę przeszkodzić naszej bohaterce. Ogólnie mówiąc, przygoda jest wciągająca i niejednokrotnie nas zaskoczy.

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
Na swojej drodze trafimy na wiele scen z ukrytymi obiektami, które możemy zastąpić grając w domino. Znajdziemy również sporo niezbyt trudnych łamigłówek. Według mnie poziom trudności scen hidden objects oraz innych zagadek mógłby być trochę wyższy jednak każdy odczuwa to trochę inaczej. Możemy zdobyć 20 osiągnięć, wypełniających naszą gablotę w grze, a widząc w pełni wypełnione zadania odczuwamy ogromną satysfakcję. 

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden posiada piękną oprawę graficzną, dopracowaną w najmniejszych szczegółach, całość klimatu dopełnia relaksujące udźwiękowienie. Opowiadana historia potrafi bardzo wciągnąć, a wiele łamigłówek sprawi, ze nie będziemy się nudzić. Jest to idealna produkcja dla graczy lubiących przygodówki, w których trzeba ruszyć głową.

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Piękna oprawa graficzna
+ Relaksujące udźwiękowienie
+ Wciągająca przygoda
+ Osiągnięcia
+ Łamigłówki
+ Sceny z ukrytymi obiektami

- Niski poziom trudności

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990809603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1483250581}
review:
Неплохой квест с разнообразными и интересными головоломками. Особых трудностей мини-игры не вызывают, так что долго сидеть и думать не придется. Есть претензии на жанр хоррор, но уж слишком притянутые. Летающие в воде трупы под страшную музыку - это не хоррор :/
Поиграть однозначно стоит, так как картинка хороша да и сюжет тоже.
Единственное, дико радует описание данной игры, где указано, что мы, оказывается, спасем свою невесту, а не жениха или мужа (бедный парень. опустили ниже плинтуса т.т).

review: 相比于这个系列其他的游戏，这款游戏优化不佳，在奖励关卡找物品的时候会变得非常卡，而且不小心点了一下重新开始，记录就不见了。虽然是比较早的游戏，但是还是希望游戏公司能够修复一下bug。

author: {'steamid': '76561198187450361', 'num_games_owned': 3164, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1481794062}
review: Очередная неплохая игра от гуру своего жанра Artifex Mundi. Квест с элементами hidden object, которые можно заменить на игру в домино. Сюжет очевидно списан с Bioshock. Девушка, в поисках своего мужа, отправляется на самое дно, где находит заброшенный подводный город Эдем. В котором ей предстоит столкнуться то ли с призраками, то ли с водоплавающими зомби, подчиненные древним ктулху-подобным демоном. Красиво нарисованные локации и хорошо подобранный саунд сразу затягивает в игру. Самое то на вечерок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 1588, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1481584513}
review:
Spielzeit : 4 Stunden mit dem Bonuskapitel (Schwieriegkeitsgrad Experte und nichts übersprungen)


Insgesamt gutes Game. Ein schöner Mix aus Wimmelbildern und Minigames. Auch die Story wurde gut erzählt und ist nicht einfach so dahin geklatscht. Schönes Leveldesign und top Soundtrack. Das einzigste etwas störende ist die Animation der Charaktere, was etwas billig ist, aber sonst gibt es nichts zu meckern. 


+ einfach 100 % Errungenschaften zu erreichen (2 Spieldurchläufe)
+ Wimmelbilder haben die Alternative Domino
+ Soundtrack
+ Story
+ Leveldesign
+ Spielzeit passt für das Genre
+ keine unlösbaren Minigames, leicht bis mittelschwer


- Charakter Animationen
- im Bonuskapitel wirken manche Wimmelbilder so als hätte man eine niedrige FPS

author: {'steamid': '76561198231764136', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1480971605}
review:
So i just played this game to get the steam card, i dont like search and puzzle games myself.

pros:
- the varity of puzzels are diverse, it's not only searching hidden items, it's also finding correct combinations etc.
- if the voice acting wasn't so bad and the animatians crap, you could actualy enjoy the plot. it's a bit far fetched, but still makes you curious how this plot is going to end

cons
- the voice acting sucks and sounds very acted, i hate listening to the voices of the characters
- the animations are crap and turn pixelated and don't run very smooth, this game won't win the beauty contest.
- if you don't like jumpscares, dont play this game, they are unexpected and quite annoying.

Summary:

it could be a fun game if you like this genre and ignore the quality of the graphics etc.
It's a game which you can enjoy for a couple of hours, even with harder modes avaible.
But if you are going to buy this game, i recomend buying it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157991580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1480705753}
review:
ถ้าไม่แคร์เรื่องรายละเอียดกลวงโบ๋และพล็อตโฮลในเนื้อเรื่องบางจุด (จะแฟนตาซียังไงก็ต้องสร้างให้มันเป็นแฟนตาซีที่สมจริงด้วยนะ) เรื่องการหาของ ไขปริศนา พัซเซิลต่างๆก็ถือว่าสนุกเพลินๆดีล่ะ

สำหรับคนที่สนใจจะเล่น ควรระวังในฉากหาของนิดนึง อันนี้เตือนเลย มีฉากอันนึงที่มุมใกล้ๆปุ่ม hint จะคลิกตรงของใกล้ๆนั้น (ไม่โดนปุ่มเลย) แต่มันก็ hint ให้เฉ้ย อด archivement เลย

ปล.ฝากถึงผู้พัฒนา..ปลาหมึกน่ะถ้ามีรูกว้างเท่ากับลูกตามัน จะที่ไหนก็เข้าได้หมดแหละ ฮือออ

author: {'steamid': '76561198064054806', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1470427735}
review:
Ótimo game, só não diria que é dificil. Os puzzles facilmente você acaba resolvendo, só tem que lembrar dos locais que tem que voltar mais tarde, mas para isso ja tem a ''ajuda'' no game que ira te ajudar caso esteja perdido.
   Em relação a historia ela é boa, acaba com um final que indica continuação, o que é bom, algo que eu relativamente gosto. O unico problema que encontrei foi no final do game em relação a um certo nudismo que tem no final, quem zerou vai entender pois quando reveleu uma certa area... era vazio, o que deixou mais estranho ainda, seria bom entao terem posto um pano sobre aquilo, só que foi apenas isso.
Super Recomendo o game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069611064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1478339263}
review:
Игра отличная. Не поклонник point-n-click'еров, да и квестов тоже не особо, но здесь и атмосфера затягивающая, и сюжет. Серьезно, в сюжете ничего прямо уж оригинального, но затягивает. Кроме того, на легком уровне сложности игру вообще можно пройти ничего не делая. На уровнях посложнее можно обойти некоторые из поисковых задач с помощью специфического домино, а вообще загадки достаточно разнообразные, не одно только "найди эти предметы". Плюс, опять же, достижения есть. 

Из недостатков игры: персонажи есть очень стильные, но есть вообще страшные, особенно детишки :) И главное: история подводного города совершенно осталась за кадром. Вся история его обитателей большей частью проходит во время наших приключений, ничего более. И да... некоторые предметы выглядят слишком неочевидно. Черт возьми, сахарница больше на солонку похожа!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017967750', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 1327, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1478015531}
review:
[h1]Artifex Mundi's game in underwater theme.[/h1]
Artifex Mundi is almost synonime to 'good hidden object game'. This is confirmation of that state.
I only encountered some minor bugs (wrong indicators).
Fair puzzles, good visuals, decent soundtrack = Artifex Mundi. =)

Unfortunately game is quite short (3-4 hours) + some bonus content, which makes it better to grab in bundle or big sale, instead of full price.
Voice acting is 'cringe' and talking animations are simplistic (only mouth area moves).
PS: I used domino's puzzle instead of objects.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1675930882}
review:
It turns out you can make a hidden object game out of just about anything, and Bioshock is no exception. I'm not being facetious here either, you can only have so many art deco steampunk underwater cities before someone starts making the connections between them. But Abyss manages to go a bit beyond Rapture with its own supernatural angle, and makes a pretty entertaining and relaxing game of it to boot.

You play a professional diver on the trail of her husband who disappeared on a routine excursion. The tutorial scenes get you to the gates of Eden, a sprawling underwater metropolis that just kinda flew under the radar, I guess? The place has been overrun by the titular wraiths, ghastly cloaked things that really do not want you finding your beau. To thwart them, you're going to have to pick up every piece of garbage you can find and solve the brain-teasers that people used to lock things in Eden instead of, y'know, actual fucking locks.

This is all very standard fare for a hidden object game, and in particular an Artifex Mundi one. As you travel about the undersea burg you'll come across hidden object scenes to solve. Each has 12 items to find, most just by clicking them but some by combining other items. Those scenes grant you an inventory item which, along with other loose objects you find, allow you to open up new areas and progress the plot. Abyss has an interesting pace to its collecting, where most of the items you need for a particular area are found in or near that area. You'll often fill up and then clear out your entire inventory in a single wing of the city, which helps cut down on laborious backtracking.

That's true until the last hour of the game, at least. Once you identify the source of the wraiths and how to defeat them, you're set on a city-wide scavenger hunt to assemble the bits and bobs to do it. This last leg involves a LOT of backtracking, almost enough to make up for the excellent pacing earlier on. There's also a central elevator you'll be using a lot that cycles through three floors without being able to select which floor to go straight to, and by the end of the game I was about sick of pulling that particular lever.

Despite these gripes, Abyss is a very solid adventure. The scenes are crisp and colorful, the puzzles are fun and have a few unique elements, and the story has a few welcome twists to keep you involved. I mentioned that it's not a straight Bioshock rip and I meant it... fans of Lovecraft might want to consider this one more seriously, in fact. There are even some good spooks to be had here, an uncommon feature for hidden object games. Your protagonist has an unfortunate habit of disturbing corpses and not noticing hostile beings until they're up in her face, and a few of those gave me some embarrassing starts.

The quality-of-life elements are all in place for a satisfying experience as well. The map is very clear with where you need to go, though it doesn't allow for fast travel. The hint system works fine, and much like many Artifex Mundi games there's an optional domino game mode that you can play in lieu of the actual hidden object scenes. It's a nice consideration for folks who want to enjoy the adventure without all the item hunting. That means that even if you aren't a HOG enthusiast, Abyss is a great way to relax and puzzle through a deep-sea city of mysteries.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988271944', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1477242132}
review:
Uno dei tanti punta e clicca della Artifex Mundi.

Che dire, sicuramente ci sono titoli MOLTO superiori rispetto a questo, poiché la trama risulta scialba; in generale ho trovato il gioco molto semplice rispetto ad altri.

La grafica risulta semplice, tuttavia molto piacevole agli occhi; mi sarebbe piaciuto avere qualche musica in più a disposizione.

Per il resto, anche se do una sufficienza a questo titolo, a parer mio potreste evitarlo se non siete veri amanti dei punta e clicca; la Artifex ci ha abituati a titoli migliori.

Voto Finale 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198098212025', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1476073950}
review:
有个地方的的翻译错了害的我花了半个小时在找，我在这里说出来，希望你们不要走弯路。
原谅我的文化水平不是很高，学习时间都花在steam上。
一个找物品的小游戏，游戏让你在场景里找泉水，我找了快十分钟，一点水了都没有发现。
我这是就在想是不是翻译错了，于是在网上打了泉水的英文，发现是跟春天spring同义的，
我再查了一下spring这个词发现还有一个弹簧的意思，我仔细找找终于被我找到了弹簧这个东西，小游戏顺利结束。
翻译有很多地方确实有问题，比如在介绍游戏的时候明显是老公救妻子，那个找泉水的小游戏，看得出制作方不用心的。
不影响游戏进程还好，但是现在的确影响到了。
不过我也从中学习学习了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198201599951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1501666830}
review:
虽然玩了Artifex Mundi公司这么多解谜游戏，这个游戏是我第一个评价的，因为我就想问为什么附加剧情里女主角要死啊？？？我感觉这个点真的是让我玩完之后不太爽。

另外玩法上那个电梯那里其实不太方便，像我就走过这张图还觉得后面有什么没点的，想要回去再点一遍，可那个电梯每次上下需要点好多次，有些烦躁。

不过这个作品倒是有几个地方真的吓到我了，也可能很久没玩这种类型的游戏的原因。

author: {'steamid': '76561198116069309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1540, 'last_played': 1448776981}
review:
Never thought I would enjoy a hidden object game but Abyss showed me that HOG can be very enjoyable. Abyss has typical but engaging hidden object gameplay which is just the right difficulty and it has an engaging and interesting story. I really enjoyed playing it and was never bored. I played it as a casual alternative to other more "hectic" games such as Borderlands and that job it did just perfectly. The story was so good that it kept me wanting to play on just to see what happens next. There are minigames one can play (which I did not do much) and they are ok too (such as dominoes) - puzzles can be skipped and those minigames be played instead so that progress can still occur (which is a good idea but I believe is quite standard in HOG these days)
There was not too much going back and forth which I really thought was positive (a lot of backtracking is something I do not enjoy in games). I guess the only downside is that the bonus which unlocks upon completion of the game is rather short but still good - after all it is a bonus and one cannot expect a fully fledged experience again as a bonus.

In summary, I strongly recommend this game. It is well made, has an interesting story and has a good length (not too long or too short). If you have never played a HOG or do not know if you like, give this one a try - you might just get into the genre of HOG. Artifex Mundi has done a really good job and I am looking forward to playing the other Artifex Mundi HOGs in my library.

Definitely a recommendation. $10 might be a little pricey - get it when it is on sale for $5 or less or when in a bundle. You will definitely get your money's worth out of it then as the game takes about 3 - 4 hours to complete including the bonus (my time is inflated as it was paused for a long while - it did not take 26 hours to finish!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141683372', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1475881161}
review:
You can never go wrong with an Artifex Mundi game!  These and gals make the finest Hidden Object Games (HoG) of all time, in my mind.  And this is one of their best!  A masterful adventure into an underwater, art-deco world, not unlike the Bioshock originals.  Many fun horror elements to keep an edge to the immersive atmosphere, as you find and assemble various parts and pieces of the story puzzles, with good actual puzzles throughout.  There were only about a half dozen or so hidden object screens, which was nice as it seemed to fit into the story nicely.  Some good animations too, in fact more than I remembered from previous games.  Game play time ran about 8 hours for me, which for the sale price was right on target.

On a 10 point scale, I give this game a solid 8.5

I can only give so many points, because I'm not really a HoG fan.  But this is as good or better than any other I can remember.  I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes Hidden Object type games, and even to those who just barely like them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198328057753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1484323989}
review:
Otro juego mas de Artifex con las ya clasica historia de misterio y los puzzles de siempre pero con un trasfondo que recordara inevitablemente a Bioshock.

Se nota que es uno de los mas antiguos juegos de Artifex ya que no dispone de los elementos mas actuales ni de la variedad de los puzzles de los juegos mas nuevos.

Recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135968267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1675061437}
review: Pretty good story and plot but everything is pretty predictable and easy to figure out with the story. Its still a good plot none the less. All the puzzles are simple to figure out or are the type where if you click randomly for like ten seconds you can get them. The object scenes are easy and quick to do and there arnt many of them and this isnt the type of game where you have to consitantly look around to make sure your not missing a scene. The game does a good job of leading you around to all the clues and it only took me lke two hours to do. There are a few jump scares that got me pretty good or caused my heart to race. There is also a bonus scene/story at the end that talks about another persons point of view of what was happening before the main character was on the scene. Simple and easy game to figure out and play. I didnt get stuck in any way and their are hint and skip buttons if you wish to use them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1495654923}
review:
Tags : Adventure - WC - Hidden Object
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Save your boyfriend from a strange underwater threat. Mechanical casual puzzles. Story ends on cliffhanger without explaining the lore.

A walk-clicker adventure game of the hidden object variety. I actually finished this one, found that most of the puzzles were mechanical in nature, which helped with their logic, usually involving using a tool or adding a gear to something. The plot was good at first when the underwater theme felt still novel, then the novelty faded and we were still left with finding the main protagonist's lover, which was dragged on for far too long. They should have made an effort to center the storyline further on what happened at the location you are visisting, adding subplots to it, as it was fairly mysterious and interesting but only superficially handled.

By the time two thirds of the way in you have a fairly strong grasp of what you are up against, and are still doing the husband chasing thing, by then the game starts to feel like it is dragging on. The conclusion was satisfactory without much cliffhanger, but is very forgettable all the same with no great reveals of any kind.

I would say this is an overall good hidden object game and would recommend it if you are hunting for one. However after playing it once I do not find myself drawn to it ever again due to the weak plot and would rather archive it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043495274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 339, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1474194752}
review:
Dans le genre Objets cachés c'est loin d'être mon préféré même s'il y a de bonnes choses. 
Après, les goûts et les couleurs...mais je vais argumenter un peu : 

* Je n'ai pas franchement accroché à la trame même s'il y a beaucoup de documentation à droite à gauche pour éclaircir tout ça et que le côté "sous l'eau" force un peu l'immersion. 
* Ah et comme moi sans doute vous vous lasserez très vite du voyage en ascenseur ! ^^
* La traduction de certaines SOC laisse à désirer, j'ai fini une ou deux scènes en cliquant à l'aveugle, enchainant les malus floutage ce qui m'a un peu coupé dans mon élan...
* La sensibilité pour combiner des objets ou effectuer des actions demande régulièrement de si reprendre à plusieurs fois ; faut être précis !
* Les puzzles sont classiques, pas de surprises ni d'innatendu.

Autre chose qui me dérange un peu et qui devient routinier pour ce genre de jeux : devoir recommencer une seconde fois pour débloquer les succès "dominos". Ce volet a quand même une bonne durée de vie + épisode bonus. (et encore plus si on se le fait deux fois pour les succès)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373667', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1469494623}
review:
[i]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/i] is one of Artifex Mundi's earlier games, but the quality makes it clear to see why they've become the top developers in the hidden object puzzle adventure genre. Since it's one of their earlier games, the art has a more painted look, and there's no fast map yet. It also has at least one classic idiosyncratic moment where there was this random box you couldn't see a way to get into, and it just happens to be smashed by an octopus right when you happen to need exactly what is in the box. Cracks me up every time!

It's often the little details that really make a game, and they didn't skimp in that area. The music perfectly fits the underwater mystery theme, and a sonar sound effect is used for hints.

I like how the story wraps up in a realistic and logical manner where you still have to escape Eden even after you defeat the demon. Although the developers left room for a sequel in the form of a possessed rat, I've never heard of any intentions to return to this universe.

The Bonus Adventure doesn't automatically pop up, so make sure you don't miss it!

review:
Took about 6 hrs and two playthroughs including extra story. 
18/20 achievements (90%)
Actually it should be 20/20 achievements but some sort of bug prevented the last two to unlock. Won't play the game a third time to try again...
It's nice to play a good Hidden Object game since the last two were disappointing. This is heavily inspired by Bioshock and with a good atmosphere, music and art.
Hope to see a sequel. 
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977147434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1472390558}
review:
Si te gustan las aventuras graficas esta es fantastica para cuando estas de resaca , enfermo o tu cerebro a llegado al "Limit break" tras intentar encontrar durante horas el alfiler del "Prisoner of Ice" , vamos que es facil como el mecanismo de un chupete , por si fuera poco te dan mil y una ayudas , te llevan de la manita , asi que hasta un mono de tres cabezas podria completarla, lo cual no quita que sea divertida bajo las condiciones ya expuestas , es facil y avanzaras en la trama ,que tampoco es de best sheller ,sin llegar al nivel de barrio sesamo es aceptable y para todos los publicos.

Si no te gustan las aventuras graficas , esta tampoco te gustara , ¿que esperabas? pero al menos incluso tu pequeño adicto al call of duty podras llegar a acabarla , que no te asuste la dificultad de combinar 2 objetos usando el puntero del raton , hasta podras darle al boton "Saltar" si al llegar a un puzzle sientes confusion porque no ahi que disparar a cosas!!

Conclusion: Aventura grafica para crios o para cuando estas tan aburrido que no sabes si jugar al pc o abrir ese libro de Arguiñano que te regalaron hace 6 navidades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013196360', 'num_games_owned': 1143, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1482764986}
review:
[h1]1/10 - Disgusting[/h1]
I don't know how garbage like this gets made.  Rip off a beautiful and iconic game franchise (Bioshock), plug it into an awful hidden object game, and rake in tens of dollars.

It's my fault for buying whatever bundle this came in and actually playing it.  It's Steam's fault for not having the curation in place to prevent this plagiarism from appearing in the store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025658024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1673232491}
review:
I got this game on sale ($3.50 instead of $10) and I recommend getting it while it's cheap, but buying it full price is fine if you're a fan of hidden-object and/or adventure games. It's a really neat mix of both (and puzzle games) that I enjoyed. Takes roughly 4 hours to beat with the bonus content.

The Cons: Voice acting is kind of flat in places, and the lip sync on the 3D model is horrific. It’s the stuff of nightmares. Also, some of the hidden-object game lists use terms that I didn’t recognize or wouldn’t have used, so that can be frustrating (it turns out there’s a mini-game in those parts you can use to skip if you’re having trouble, tho!). The hidden-object parts are sometimes a little iffy in terms of application (why do you spend all this time picking up 20 things when the one thing you wanted was on top?) and there's the "your knife broke after one use" adventure-game tendency, which is a pain.

The Pros: Story is fairly interesting, if a bit clunkily delivered, scenery is a gorgeous and interesting mix of 3D (moving parts) and somewhat painterly 2D… it’s a little hard to describe but it generally works well. The adventure-game components are like 90% logical and easy to guess, and the rest can be picked up on pretty fast. It's very fun, easy to play while still being challenging and interesting.

While the con section is visibly longer, this is still a fun game, and I recommend it, especially on the cheap.

review:

[h1][b]Download contents DLC[/b][/h1] None.
[h1][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/h1] I think that's only from my computer but refer to (*) at the end.
[h1][b]Worth price[/b][/h1] It deserve almost its full price if you accept the (#) and (*) points below.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

This isn't one of my favorite Artifex Mundi game but the game is fine.

Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden relate the story of an explorer who has gone missing in the sea while searching for something underwater. You play as the explorer's wife who used to go underwater with her husband. She'll need to retrieve the track of him in the Eden city and save what is left from this utopian underwater city confronting wraiths and hazards. The additional story let you play a Eden citizen who will need to rescue his wife and their baby.


The story and graphics are good. Puzzles and hidden objects scenes are fairly shared.

The game features an inventory where you can store items to combine with the environment to go deeper in the story. 

The game has several difficulties and have a guest feature: all the family can play the game and resume it where they left. There is also a map which is useful when you're lost and that may have some hints if you play in an easier mode. Also you can use the Hint/Skip hourglass whenever you want and wait until its refill to use it again. But be warned that you may not skip or use a hint in any puzzle or hidden objects scene if you wish to have some achievements.

There is a good choice of puzzles and there are two kind of Hidden objects scenes. The first Hidden objects scene features the name of the objects to find some are found easily (normal one) and some others need you to interact with the environment or to combine two items to found them. The second Hidden objects scene let you find the shape of the objects in the scene.

(#) :
The game has some achievements that can be missed which are challenging and difficulty achievements. One difficulty achievement asks you to play the game in Expert mode. Challenging achievements require you to finish a puzzle or a hidden objects scene or a dominoes game under one minute. You also need to solve every puzzle and hidden objects scene without skipping or using hints. Another achievement requires you to find 3 objects in 3 seconds or find all objects with only 5 or fewer miskicks in the hidden object scenes. Because of the achievements the game requires you to play two playthroughs of the main story in order to get both Hidden Objects Scenes and Dominoes games achievements. The bonus story let you play it Also I guess you need to get all achievements on the same player.
(*):
My computer had a drop of FPS (frame per second) while playing the additional content. My computer has some issues so I guess the issue is from my computer and not from the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025159178', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1488129229}
review:
Nie zrozumcie mnie źle. Gra jest dobra. Nie świetna, ale dobra. Ocenę negatywną wystawiam za to, że gra zrobiona jest przez polską firmę, a jakość polskiej wersji jest koszmarna. Wielokrotnie zagatki ukrytych obiektów każą ci znaleźć coś co nijak nie ma się do tego co masz kliknąć. Dla przykładu gra każe ci znaleźć pędzel a oczekuje kliknięcia szczotki, koralowiec nazwano porostem, ale najgorsza była marchewka (czy inne warzywo) nazwane papugą. Takich błędów tłumaczeń było na tyle dużo, że pod koniec gry zaczęłam się przestawiać na myślenie w kategoriach "Co autorzy mogli nazwać X?".

Reszta gry jest w porządku a zagadki są do rozwiązania odrobiną logicznego myślenia, a główną trudnością w tych zagadkach jest to, że w jednej chwili masz dostęp do dużej ilości miejsc w których trzeba coś zrobić ale twoje narzędzia pasują tylko do kilku z nich i trzeba wymyśleć do których.

Z początku zagadki są wymyślne i interesujące, pod koniec gry jednak czuć, że autorom zaczęło brakować pomysłów i zaczęli rzucać klasycznymi denerwującymi łamigłówkami typu naciśnij jeden element a zaświecają się sąsiednie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066465742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1466693320}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007627220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1461929655}
review:
[h1]Очень не плохая игра в жанре «скрытые предметы»[/h1]

Главная героиня отправляется вглубь океана, чтобы найти своего пропавшего жениха. Начинается всё как Bioshock – подводный город когда-то сияющий и многолюдный, а теперь пустынный и полуразрушенный. Потом появляются ни то призраки ни то одержимые и сюжет перетекает в обычную мистику с древним демоном. Между тем сюжет достаточно интересен и выяснить что же случилось хочется.

Игровой процесс стандартный для подобных игр. Режим поиска предметов сделан хорошо – предметы не сливаются с фоном и неплохо видны. Загадки все понятные и пройти их можно самостоятельно.

Картинка в игре приятная. Локации красивые и разнообразные. Единственное, что их не много и приходится по одним и тем же местам бегать по нескольку раз.

Игра для своего жанра очень хорошая, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181345633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1465668124}
review: Ein tolles Spiel, es macht sehr viel Spass, spannend gemacht und schöne Grafik. Aber ein sehr großes Manko ist das Bonuskapitel, welches mich an den Rand der Verzweiflung gebracht hat. Denn bei den Wimmelbildern fing das Spiel an zu Ruckeln und extrem langsam zu laufen, selbst, wenn man es versucht über die Dominospiele auszuweichen. Schrecklich! Solbald man raus war, lief aber dann alles wieder flüßig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188927953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1465606503}
review: I just finished the game and was nice and satisfying a good game if you want to relax or not have to do a lot of things to get further in it, and enjoyed the puzzles and the story in it and the octupus did not have a big part in it which would of been nice to have as a side enemy. The wraiths look terryfying like a Scooby Doo villian and when I saw Greg I thought he was a villian and it turned out he was a good guy and on your side in the game. The graphics and sound work and objects are easy to find and was quite interesting to see your character get knocked out by someone or trapped and having to rescue your lover and others. The bonus chapter is a prequel and focuses on Greg where it shows his wife and how they were enslaved by the wraiths which was sad, and usually in these games the bonus is a sequel to the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025246242', 'num_games_owned': 3890, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1465512926}
review: Gra, jak większość Artifex Mundi jest całkiem sympatyczna. Kilka błędów w tłumaczeniu podczas szukania obiektów..Dziwne, że podczas scenek występują przycinki. Historia służy tylko do rozwiązywania zagadek. Dobra grafika, świat wzorowany na Bioshocku i Rapture. Dla jednych wada, dla drugich zaleta. Mocne 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1462349438}
review:
Tras mi desastrosa experiencia con "The Panic Room", juré bajo el sol y con un puñado de hierba arrancada en mi mano que jamás jugaría a truños de buscar objetos y tonterías así, pero alguien me recomendó los juegos de Artifex Mundi, que no están plagados de opciones chorras y botones inútiles que molestan y no te dejan jugar tranquilo, además, recordé que Efrin me había regalado éste hacía ya un tiempo, así que lo probé.
"Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden" es un juego de buscar objetos y resolver sencillos puzzles, que es más o menos lo que esperaba, pero mezclado con dos cucharaditas de café de aventura gráfica. Más que un juego, es un pasatiempo sencillote donde a no ser que seas un retrasado, será imposible quedarse atascado. En este juego (o pasatiempo) en concreto llevaremos a una buceadora que va a rescatar a un rollete de fin de semana que se pierde en una ciudad submarina llamada Raptur..., bueno, no recuerdo. El caso es que por ahí merodean unos tipos con túnica muy cabronzuelos, de los que ponen raggetón a toda hostia en los lugares públicos y aún no consiguen encajar bien la gorra en sus cabezas. En el juego tendremos que ir recogiendo cosas del suelo, pero cosas útiles, no colillas para fumártelas. También pasaremos a pantallas donde tendremos que buscar una lista de cosas entre un montonaco de objetos, tipo [i]armario de los trastos[/i]. Por si fuera poco, se nos intercalarán puzzles, también sencillos, ojo, no como los de "The 7th Guest" o "The 11th Hour". Cada vez que resolvemos un puzzle o terminamos una pantalla [i]de encontrar cosas[/i], conseguiremos otro objeto, que puesto en el lugar indicado, nos permite acceder a nuevos sitios y seguir resolviendo cosas.
Si eres una persona acostumbrada a las aventuras gráficas, no vas a quedarte atascado en ningún momento en este juego, pero sí encontrarás la satisfacción de terminar puzzles, encontrar cosas y demás. Es como si pagas por sexo: satisfacción sin complicaciones. Pues eso es lo que es los juegos de [i]Hidden Object[/i], el prostíbulo de las aventuras gráficas.
El aspecto gráfico está bastante bien, aunque con un tufillo en ciertos momentos a juego simplón, pero cumple. La historia está de más, pues parece un cuento de género [i]juvenil[/i] genérico, es decir, poderes antiguos, "elegidos", niños, "cosas místicas" y toda esa parafernalia imprescindible en libros juveniles con portadas ultracoloreadas.

[b]"Los [i]Hidden Object[/i] son el prostíbulo de las aventuras gráficas". ¿Te has quedado agusto con tu reflexión del día?[/b] Más agusto que un arbusto.
[b]No me puedo quitar la sensación de que es más un juego típico de móvil que una aventura.[/b] No vengas con rollos y prueba el juego, como hice yo.
[b]Vale, éste te lo regalaron, pero ¿te comprarás más tú?[/b] Pues yo qué sé. Hablaré con mi director financiero a ver qué presupuesto tenemos, que la semana pasada compramos 3 jets y tuvimos que ir a Panamá por unos asuntos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037502679', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1462992709}
review:
Just finished off this game and must say it was a very nice puzzle game.
The story is well told and interesting. Some puzzles you get to think a bit more but otherwise it is pretty straightforward.
If you got some time to enjoy a nice puzzle game with a nice story I recommend it.
I got this game in a package deal and was nicely suprised.
As always I recommend highest difficulty, Expert, in this case. It isn't that hard just makes it so you have to use your nugget a bit more ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198172454749', 'num_games_owned': 2937, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1465274992}
review:
[h1]잘 만들어진 히든 오브젝트게임.[/h1]

2012년도 게임임에도 요즘 나온 다른 히든 오브젝트게임와 비교해서 그래픽이나 여타 부분에서 전혀 뒤쳐지지 않는 게임이다.
이 게임은 심해의 악몽1탄 다음으로 만들어진 게임으로 이런 류의 게임으로서는 상당히 초창기 게임이라고 할수 있는데,
그래픽이나 퍼즐 등 게임성은 전혀 손색이 없지만,

단 하나 초창기 게임이다보니까 이동이 조금 귀찮다.
최근에 나온 히든 오브젝트게임들은 지도상에서 자신이 가고 싶은 지역을 클릭하면 곧바로 이동이 가능하지만
이 게임은 클릭에도 이동은 안되기 때문에 게임화면 상에서 이동을 직접 해줘야 하는게 조금 귀찮을 따름이다.

그외에는 잘 만든 게임인데 이 게임도 1회차 플레이로는 도전과제가 모두 완료되지 않는다.
그래서, 최소 2회를 해야 하고 도전과제 중에서 1분안에 도미노게임을 마무리하라는게 있는데
그게 제일 어려운 도전과제라고 할수 있다.
숨은그림찾기 대신에 하는 도미노게임은 생각보다 시간이 걸리기때문에 1분 안에 끝내기란 상당히 어렵다.

그리고, 도전과제를 모두 완료할려면 메인스토리 엔딩 후에 서브스토리도 마저 클리어를 하도록 하자.
엔딩을 보는데 총 3~4시간 정도가 걸리는 게임이다.
평점 90점.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289652062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1462390011}
review:
走地图走得要疯了，为啥不能用地图走啊！那个电梯走了无数次了，哦，还有那个图书馆！起码30%的时间都用在走路上了！
Artifex Mundi的万年悲剧——中文翻译没有最坑爹只有更坑爹！神一样的泉水=弹簧，铁=熨斗，睡莲=百合，鱼鳞=秤，坏掉的镜子=坏运气，某种昆虫=手杖，珊瑚=海竿……种种错误数不胜数……
男主存在的意义是什么，被女主拯救还要傲娇状：“哼要不是看在你那么能干救了我一次的份上我才不会大发慈悲的和你结婚呢~”这种渣渣男主不分留着过清明么……
剧情反转太突兀，一言不合就黑化，一言不合就失踪。求着女主拯救世界说完话就跑，也不管女主当时还被困在地下室……
打折到10元还能买来玩玩，原价买会心疼死……多的钱还不如拿去喝杯热牛奶呢……

author: {'steamid': '76561198260664411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1473610178}
review:
Приятная казуальная игрушка. Даже сложность "эксперт" берется с полплевка, поэтому чего-то особого мозгонапрягательного от нее ждать не стоит. Но плюс: в ней не только поиск предметов, но и всякие мини-игры. В целом, для повтыкать и расслабиться - очень приятно.

Что в игре отдельным плюсом, так это история.
Пропал аквалангист, его любовный интерес (наша ГГ) поехала на поиски. Собственно, ходит, ищет и вскрывает при этом историю Эдема - тайного эксперимента по созданию свободного города под водой. Увы и ах, во время раскопок нашли некий алтарь, сломали одну печать, дали демону просочиться в наш мир, постепенно начался трэшак и очаровательная подводная утопия сменилась антиутопией с элементами Сопротивления и мервыми роженницами (об этом можно больше узнать в дополнении, которое входит в коллекционное издание).
Героиня в итоге спасает своего парнишу, он предлагает ей поженихаться, они сбегают из полуразрушенного Эдема на подводной лодке. Поверхность, закат, "славабогувсезакончилось" (БУАГАГА, - сказала я, ну и оказалась права).

Однозначно казуальное да.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056385260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1460988389}
review:
[h1]Для тех кто любит игры в стиле поиска предметов, и тех кто предпочитает играть в спокойные игры.[/h1] Ну, чтож, играл во многое в этом жанре и такие игры следует разделить на плюсы и минусы, так как говорить о таких играх, никак иначе нельзя. [h1]Итак плюсы:[/h1]
[h1]Атмосфера.[/h1] Было бы очень замечательно, если бы выходило побольше игр с такой атмосферой, окружающим миром. В начале игры уже чувствует [i]Bioshock[/i], а еще дальше как будто попадаю в рассказ Г.Ф. Лавкрафта, ну или по крайне мере что то похожее.
[h1]Сюжет.[/h1] Если бы сюжет был порядком мрачнее, как например в [i]Real Horror Stories[/i], я бы рекомендовал поиграть всем, а так, все банальненько. Поиск предметов, главный герой - девушка спасающая своего любимого, в бонусной предыстории - мужчина спасающий свою жену, при чем история намного короче оригинала. Как обычно в принципе.
[h1]Приятный плюс.[/h1] Система достижений и карточек,  очень сильно дополняют игру по моему мнению, приятно играть в такую простую игру и при этом получать еще и достижения. 
[h1]Головоломки.[/h1] Очень инетересные, моментами легкие, а бывает первые 2 минуты, не можешь понять что делать, но играется интересно. Это даже как то скрашивает само однообразие поиска предметов и взаимодействия с вещами. 
[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
- Однообразие.
- Хотелось бы что бы это было хотя бы в стиле хоррора от первого лица.
- Банальность сюжета, не хватает мрачности.
- Цена - брать только по скидке.
В итоге игра в общем то интересная, короткая, для тех кто любит расслабиться после рабочего дня за какой нибудь простенькой игрой, самое то. Ну и для любителей, разумеется, тоже рекомендую. [h1]Оценил: 4.3 / 5[/h1]

Обзор написал Hilbert Schwarz.

--------------------------------------------------------------

[h1] For those who loves games in style of search of objects, and that who prefers to play quiet games. [/h1] Well that, I played a lot of things in this genre and such games it is necessary to divide into pluses and minuses as to speak about such games, differently it is impossible in any way. [h1] So pluses: [/h1]
[h1] Atmosphere. [/h1] Would be very remarkable if there were more games with such atmosphere, world around. At the beginning of game [i] of Bioshock [/i], and further away already feels as though I am included in G. F. Lovecraft's story, well or on extremely measure that that similar.
[h1] Plot. [/h1] If the plot was order more gloomy, such as in [i] Real Horror Stories [/i], I would recommend to play everything, and so, everything is banal. Search of objects, the main character - the girl rescuing the darling in bonus background - the man rescuing the wife at what history is much shorter than the original. As usual in principle.
[h1] Pleasant plus. [/h1] the System of achievements and cards, very strongly supplement game in my opinion, it is pleasant to play such simple game and at the same time to receive also achievements. 
[h1] Of the Puzzle. [/h1] Very interesting, the moments lungs, and happens the first 2 minutes, you can't understand what to do, but is played interestingly. It even as that brightens up monotony of search of objects and interaction with things. 
[h1] Minuses: [/h1]
- Monotony.
- It would be desirable that it was at least in style of a horror from the first person.
- Banality of a plot, isn't enough gloom.
- The price - to take only on a discount.
As a result game in general interesting, short, for those who likes to relax after the working day behind any unpretentious game, most that. Well and for fans, certainly, too I recommend. [h1] Has estimated: 4.3 / 5 [/h1]

The review has been written Hilbert Schwarz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150535582', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1498752778}
review:
这一作是我第一次尝试玩这种类型的游戏
除此之外我就只有观看别人的实况视频
个人对这种游戏并不反感
但在我漫长的刷成就的过程，我实在是没有剩下什么愉悦的感情了，尤其我还喜欢收集成就
隐藏物品的翻译。。。实在是令人无语，有些东西真的翻译前后意思差之千里
弹簧叫春天，海珊瑚叫海竿，熨斗叫铁，指针叫手，手杖竟然是只竹节虫。。。海盐又是什么东西，兽瘟，那叫海鳗啊，放射物符号叫蜥蜴符号...
这些都是谷歌翻译出来没有核对过的结果，我忍了，大不了多跑一下英文就是了
让我生气是成就完成的判定
我现在已经通关了大概十六七次左右吧，估计还得至少再重新开两三次才能达到全成就，成就收集好像有bug,一直卡在完成全部场景隐藏物品和多米诺上，一直都是差两个，把我急的啊。。。我不知道我还是否有毅力去完成它。
在漫长的刷成就的过程中绝望了，对于游戏流程现在大概已经会背下来了
游戏，玩玩就好

author: {'steamid': '76561198009334801', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1459872192}
review:
Premessa: finora avevo provato solo un paio di giochi Hidden Object per giusto un manciata di minuti, e non mi avevano detto niente. Cambia schermata, cerca senza alcun senso: cavolo, scolapasta, torre Eiffel, portaerei, circuito integrato per proseguire con la storia, ripeti fino alla fine. 
Molto emozionante.
Perciò quando ho visto che avevo questo gioco in libreria (preso immagino in qualche bundle) sono stato un po' titubante, magari fa schifo, magari è una rottura come gli altri, vabbè oh proviamolo.

E niente, forse sono stato fortunato a iniziare con questo, perché invece sembra davvero più un'avventura grafica che un HO, cosa di cui non posso che rendere grazie.

La storia: noi siamo una tizia che cerca suo marito subacqueo scomparso e scopre che è finito a Rapt.. volevo dire, [i]Eden[/i], una città sottomarina che sembra infestata da strane figure incappucciate. 
A parte l'ovvio plagio a Bioshock, la trama rimane abbastanza cheesy per tutto il gioco, con dialoghi (e doppiaggio) che vorrebbero comunicare un senso di tensione e pericolo, ma finiscono quasi sempre col risultare involontariamente comici (gli spettri che scrivono ALTOLA'! sulla porta, stupendo). Però, immaginando che questo genere di giochi non brilli per la profondità delle sue trame, ammetto che le innumerevoli citazioni lovecraftiane mi hanno fatto piacere e sono state rese bene.

Il gameplay è strutturato a schermate fisse in cui raccogliere roba, usarla per risolvere enigmi vari e procedere. Ora, suppongo che non tutti i HO siano così, ma qui c'è una netta prevalenza degli enigmi rispetto alle schermate HO (o Schermate Oggetti Nascosti, SON come vengono chiamate nel gioco). Enigmi che spaziano dai soliti codici, pannelli da sistemare, cose da girare e abbinare, colori, un po' tutto il classico campionario che chiunque abbia giocato a un Professor Layton sa a menadito, ma la varietà rimane buona e gli enigmi non troppo complessi e divertenti da risolvere (a parte un paio più noiosi). 
C'è in ogni caso sempre un sistema di suggerimenti in base alla difficoltà scelta, ed è anche possibile saltarli in toto - ma confido che voi mettiate la difficoltà massima e non usiate alcun suggerimento, che è il modo giusto per giocarle ogni avventura grafica che si rispetti.
Anche le SON, per chi non avesse voglia di trovare tutti gli oggetti (alcuni richiedono anche l'interazione tra più oggetti, es. fiammiferi + pipa = "fumo", l'oggetto da trovare), sono risolvibili in un altro modo, tramite un minigioco del domino molto più semplice e banale. 
L'unica cosa che mi ha un po' confuso e bloccato a più riprese è il fatto che si debba ritornare sulle SON già risolte, per risolverle di nuovo (con altri oggetti) e ottenere qualcos'altro di fondamentale per proseguire nel gioco. Magari è una cosa comune ai HO, ma non la sapevo e ci ho messo un po' a capirlo. Quindi: se vi bloccate, riprovate quelle schermate.

Per il resto, parecchio backtracking ma con un senso, ambienti bellissimi che rendono bene la città sottomarina, buoni effetti sonori, una traduzione italiana ben fatta ma chiaramente senza contesto (cosa che a volte può rendere difficile capire che oggetto si debba cercare nelle SON, perché evidentemente tradotto in modo diverso rispetto all'oggetto vero e proprio) e una serie di enigmi finali che non sfigurano affatto davanti a produzioni più famose come quelle di Boakes (Dark Fall) e simili. La longevità è sorprendentemente buona e si attesta sulle 7-8 ore (senza aiuti), mentre tra gli Extra c'è pure un capitolo prequel bonus della durata di un'oretta.

Insomma, una bella sorpresa che non poteva introdurmi in modo migliore al mondo dei HO, e che mi invoglia a comprarne altri degli stessi sviluppatori.
Ma solo se ci sono più enigmi, che continuo comunque a preferire alle SON.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1457913200}
review: One of the earlier Atrifex Mundi titles, in later titles you have a few more things to make the game a little better like fast travel through the map etc. but it's still a good game. The describe it as a scary and thrilling story, but if you played Bioshock there are some familiarities, mainly of the ground concept of underwater City that was meant to be heaven on earth, where men could be free and it was a place for smart people, then something happend and now everything is horror themed. I wouldn't call it scary, even if they try to set the mood early on in the game. But it's hard to feel scared when you move by clicking yourself from place to place. The do it as well as you can though. The game features the same quality of artwork that I've come to expect from them. Good ambiance, music and sounds. Voice acting is in general okey, except for a few who went for an oscar and failed. It's not as good as the later titles from Atrifex Mundi, but still a solid game, and if you haven't played the later titles, it's great to start on, to see what they have to offer in the terms of quality. Puzzles aren't as hard as the later titles either, which can be a positive or negative, depending on how good you are at them. Overall a recommend! 6.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198259006212', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1486703313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088679718', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1457089651}
review:
★★★★★★★☆☆☆
More than 4 hours of great entertainment with point&click adventure game including a lot of puzzles, hidden-object minigames etc. The most impressive element of Atrifex Mundi productions are definitely graphics (look at screenshots - most of locations are just masterpieces) and music, creating awesome climat. In case of [b]Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden[/b] we've got ruins of underwater city and story inspired strongly by Lovecraft, Verne and classic dystopia. They should work a bit on suspense and giving player the willies, but in general it's still very rewarding game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105096861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1457474588}
review: Exciting puzzles, hidden object and an underwater city that's been overrun by demons that want to kill you. What more could you want?

author: {'steamid': '76561198104629773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1456761637}
review:
其实想玩这个公司的解谜游戏系列很久了，毕竟自带简中好评（虽然有严重到印象游戏性的翻译错误，比如泉水=弹簧0m 0）
流程意外地比我想象中其实要长（其实是蛮合适的，是我自己估量得太短了0m 0
寻物游戏很亲切地附带了一个多米诺游戏给那些不愿意找东西的玩家跳过这个流程的选择，这点很棒

不过谈到剧情方面的话，就很无趣了，玩下来只不过体验了一个干巴巴的冒险故事，感觉完全可以再雕琢一番起码让故事令人有些印象，现在的故事让我觉得跳过是完全不亏的0m 0
最后就是，主角的习惯好差啊，用过的道具就以一定要丢掉吗！好几处地方总给我一种：啊啊啊啊这个地放如果之前的道具还在的话不是就可以用到，为什么还要重新去找新物件破关啦混——这样的感觉

author: {'steamid': '76561198031542514', 'num_games_owned': 3875, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1456532699}

author: {'steamid': '76561198163926961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1455141468}
review: Kolejna świetna gra od Artifex Mundi - bardzo klimatyczna, z miłą dla ucha ścieżką dźwiękową i rewelacyjną fabułą z lekkim dreszczykiem grozy ;) Gracz wciela się w narzeczoną/żonę (?) płetwonurka, który zaginął w morskiej otchłani. Odkrywa przy okazji podwodne miasto, a w nim tajemnicze stwory, które najwyraźniej nie są przyjaźnie nastawione do nowych przybyszów... Gorąco polecam :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198097670907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1451099515}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077817772', 'num_games_owned': 1626, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1456320662}
review:
another nice but a bit short casual hidden object game from Artifex Mundi and this time the story take place in a city under water ruled by  demons that took possession of the people that used to live there, kinda reminds me of the first bioshock game.
 there is even a bonus chapter that relate events before the main story so you can understand what happens before you arrive to the city.
the puzzles and mini games are various and challenging the graphics and sound effect are good as usual , no bugs or glitches
+ 23 easy achievements and 3 cards
recommend it for hidden object and casual game fans ( grab it on sales)

review:
A nice hidden object/puzzle game.I`d suggest getting it on a discount if you`re into these sort of indie games.

-bad acting
-the story could be much better (not really a minus but it was a bit dull and something you probabbly already saw)

+steam achivements

author: {'steamid': '76561198043305797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1455555548}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146202794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1590267655}
review:
Проходится быстро, головоломки не зубодробительные, предметы находятся легко.
Все достижения легко заработать за 2 прохождения (~6 часов)
В общем для подобного рода игр вполне стандартно.
Сюжетик...ммм в паре мест хромает логика, но пережить можно :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042460330', 'num_games_owned': 2704, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1454634636}
review:
Abyss is very clearly a rip-off of Bioshock in both theme and plot. The voice acting is passable at best, and the animation (or, what of it there is) is downright atrocious.

Despite this, the game is surprisingly charming. The finer points of the story really do draw you in, and you somehow care about the characters. The puzzles are fun, engaging, and at times quite difficult. Although the soundtrack isn't extensive, it's actually quite nice and helps the game to be immersive. The art is really quite lovely, and the point and the hidden objects are cleverly disguised. It's a great way to relax and unwind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054982103', 'num_games_owned': 1994, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1408401974}
review: Another really entertaining Point & Click mystery solving game, simple storyline, 2 - 3 playthroughs to get all achievements in the game, short and sweet and overall a good game to help pass a couple of stray nights worth of boredom. Nothing too difficult, the puzzles are child friendly and rarely gave any problems having them solved... I quote "rarely"!! I wouldn't DARE complain at this game one bit, due to the lack of money I paid, which was a couple of pounds for 5 off a bundle site, and was 100% worth the price i paid and wouldn't have minded paying a little bit more than what I did! 8/10

review:
二周目不看对话，跟一周目一样费力，甚至跟个无头苍蝇一样。有些地方的触发范围太小，搞得头疼。还有很多处的翻译错误，有些成就一周目就完成不了。
总体来说是个不错的解谜游戏。
但是，谁来告诉我，额外内容怎么触发？
已经三模式三周目通关了，能解锁的成就都解锁了。
额外内容怎么触发？？？

author: {'steamid': '76561198277853041', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1625385696}
review: Artifex Mundi公司的一贯风格，总体上难度适中，以前玩过点击类解谜游戏并且对Artifex Mundi公司风格比较喜欢的玩家可以尝试

author: {'steamid': '76561198210814135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1449141859}
review:
Artifex Mundi家的游戏我玩过不少了。但只有这一作让我感到极其的烦躁和恶心。
地图没有快速旅行，很多地方来来回回的跑，电梯只能下到最底才能往上，上到最顶才能往下，而且每层都要停一次开门一次，感觉像是强行延长游戏时间一般。
人物对话时脸部很僵硬，介绍中说的“惊险刺激的游戏情节”就是时不时的突然冒出个干尸吓人。结尾剧情很糟糕，而且看起来像是要有续作的样子，然而这么多年了并没有续作。
当然这些都不是我感到烦躁和恶心的原因。
游戏中有一些谜题是在箱子中寻物，要把上面的物品挪开寻找压在下面的物品。不知道是我手残还是怎么着，很多压在上面的物品挪不开。挪开了又会瞬移回原处。我也因此没有发现压在箱子最下面的另一个小小的物品，导致卡关半小时。而期间我点击过很多次游戏内置的提示功能，都没有提示我去那个箱子里找。
以及由于翻译问题，很多寻物谜题的物品死活找不到，翻译的非常离谱，根本无法联想到，只能自己乱点或是通过内置的提示功能找到物品。但是！有的物品他是没有设置提示的！不知道是不是游戏的开发者认为这个再眼瞎也会找到所以就没有设置提示，但这当然要建立在翻译没有错误的前提下！我记得非常清楚，就在那个鲨鱼骨架的寻物谜题那块，有个叫“海竿”的东西，我把所有和“竿”相关的东西都点了一个遍，都不是。我点提示，但是这个物品并没有被设置提示！迫不得已我去查了攻略，但是寻物谜题每次需要寻找的物品并不是完全相同的，是随机的，所以攻略的作者所遇到的这寻物谜题里并没有这个“海竿”！于是我就这么绝望的满屏幕点点点点点点，点了好久好久，最后点到了背景里的一个像一坨绿色的珊瑚还是水草的东西，这玩意是“海竿”？“海竿”究竟特么是什么东西？？？是我书读的太少还是没有生活常识？？？
所以，什么都不要说了！差评！
