author: {'steamid': '76561198107604716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 4570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1638842949}
review: Pour pas part, je trouve ce jeu superbement bien dessiné, on s'y croirait, il est surprenant de vérité, de belles choses intelligeantes et très recherchées. Les énigmes ne sont pas faciles certes, même "pour le facile débutant". Il faut beaucoup de calme et de patience et ne pas hésiter à revenir sur votre chemin car avec le plan on s'y retrouve très facilement. Les lignes rouges ne sont pas interdites c'est seulement la couleur des circuits. Par contre attention un mot traduit en français n'est pas forcément ce que l'on croit, il faut beaucoup d'imagination pour ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025136362', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1402238418}
review:
A very satisfying point and click/hidden object adventure game.

Pros:

-Excellent story
-Diverse themes for hidden object puzzles
-Beautiful art deco environments
-Surprisingly good voice acting

Cons:

-A little short:  4 hour playthrough on medium difficulty
-Difficulty:  medium felt VERY easy

If you go in without expectations of difficulty and just want to enjoy the scenery, this game is a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971138420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1402220996}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198087020268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1402216770}
review:
바닷속의 유적을 탐험하러 갔다가 실종되어 버린 연인을 찾아 나서는
내용의 어드벤처 게임. 보통 왕자가 공주를 구하러 가는게 일반적인
내용이지만, 역으로 여자가 남자를 구하러 나선다. ^^

연인을 구하기 위해선 역시 여러 난관에 부딪히게 되는데, 문제를
해결하기 위해 물건을 구하고, 조합하고, 숨은 그림을 찾는 등 개인차에
따라 다르겠지만 기본 틀은 가볍게 풀만한 내용이 대부분이며, 
문제 풀이에 익숙치 않는 초보 유저에게도 친절하게 힌트 게이지를
사용하여 문제를 쉽게 해결이 가능하여 적절하게 사용한다면 
시간 낭비 없이 즐겁게 게임에 임할 수 있고,

무엇보다 한글판이라는점은 문제 풀이에 있어 가장 중요한 언어에
대한 부담을 완벽하게 해소하여 주기 때문에 가장 높은 점수를 주고 싶다.


* 해당 제작사의 어드벤처 장르의 게임 대부분이 한글판이라 어비스가
 마음에 들었다면 다른 작품도 즐겨보는것도 나쁘지 않을것 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095504455', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1402210936}
review: It was, ok. Runs well at least for a mobile port. If you can get it on sale it may be worth it if you like hidden object puzzle games, I wouldn't recommend at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1402097411}
review: Yep, it's another hidden-object game with a supernatural theme.  I have yet to play one of these that isn't about some grim subject matter.  This one also has the structure of a really easy point-and-click adventure. The whole thing took around 6 hours to beat, including a bonus level. I enjoyed the game. It was light and breezy and I didn't get stuck as to what to do next. It was a very casual experience. If you like the genre, you're probably going to like this one too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040840273', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1402162757}
review:
Point-and-click Bioshock. What could be better?

As of writing this, I've played the game for about 90 minutes, all in one sitting. I am really enjoying the story, and the characters  seem to be very interesting. It's your basic point-and-click adventure game, but it has some shocks, and the overall atmosphere is pretty creepy. The game isn't bogged down too much in the minigames (other than maybe the hidden picture puzzles) and there is at least a variety to experience, it even has dominos!

I would have to say my favorite thing about the game is at the very least, a reasonable expectation of replayability. There are three difficulty settings, which, if I read correctly, have slightly different stories, and there's even an achievement for completing the hardest difficulty. What I consider to be the biggest flaw is how well it sits in the uncanny valley. When you watch a person talk, you'll know what I mean.

Overall, though, it's a pretty good, creepy horror-ish point-and-click adventure game that I think is worth your time. $8 doesn't seem like a high price for the game, and I suspect I'll be getting another 2+ hours of entertainment from it, so it's worth the money to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027914184', 'num_games_owned': 1064, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1401984757}
review: Quite a nice game. Usually I'm nota fan of that kind of games, but I had a good time gettting through it. Rather simple, which might be disadvantage for veterans, I for me it was enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035451828', 'num_games_owned': 1865, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1402035723}
review:
从谜画之塔开始就大爱手绘风的AVG，这款游戏的视觉效果令人满意，2D背景+3D动态效果所呈现出来的画面非常漂亮，但是过场动画分辨率略显粗糙。
游戏故事剧情很弱，但是BGM很动听，谜题基本没有难度，所以玩起来比较流畅。
有中文语言实在让人感动，但是少量翻译有误，不过在可承受范围内。
要全成就至少打两遍，建议一次休闲，一次专家，一次全玩多米诺，一次全玩来找茬。

author: {'steamid': '76561198119203627', 'num_games_owned': 1299, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1402040007}
review:
숨은 그림 찾기 스타일의 퍼즐 게임입니다.

저는 같은 제작사의 작품 중 Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart를 먼저 해보고 평가를 남겼으니 참고하셔도 됩니다.
http://steamcommunity.com/id/eunhwak/recommended/259740/

위 작품과 비교하여 Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden에서 느낀 점을 간략하게 써봅니다.
컷신이 강화되었습니다.
한국어 번역의 질이 나아졌습니다. (그래도 오타는 여전히 종종 보입니다.)
퍼즐 중에 불필요한 오브젝트를 치워서 아래에 깔린 중요 오브젝트를 찾는 퍼즐이 있는데, 약간의 버그가 있어서 좀 불편합니다.

이런 종류의 게임을 좋아하시는 분들께는 무난한 선택이 될 것 같습니다.

본편을 재미있게 플레이하셨다면, 기타에 있는 보너스 콘텐츠 플레이도 해보세요. 그레고리가 주인공이 되어서 플레이합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960902680', 'num_games_owned': 1494, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1401881759}
review:
Ein sehr interessantes Rätselspiel mit Point&Click Einlagen.

Ich habe es erst einmal auf Einfach durchgespielt, da man auf Experte leichte Probleme bekommen könnte den richtigen Weg zu finden.
Allerdings ist eben jene Hinführung eigentlich sehr gut gelungen. Ich wusste in der Regel sofort was man woher bekommen konnte. Gerade, wenn man aufmerksam alle Texte liest und sich auf die Story einlässt ist es nicht all zu schwer (manche Rätsel aber schon!).

Die Story ansich ist ein wenig sehr abstrus und ohne wirklichen vor- und nachgelagerten Teil. Man weiß also nicht in welchem Jahr alles spielt oder ob es überhaupt die reale Welt ist.

Mein Urteil ist, dass sich ein Kauf auf jeden Fall lohnt.

review:
A nice adventure game, as a casual user of this genre, I enjoyed it. It's a little bit short.

Things I liked:

Things I don't liked:

author: {'steamid': '76561198024983274', 'num_games_owned': 2676, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1402216279}
review:
This game came with a cheap bundle, and what a surprise: the comfiest game that i have ever played.
Cheesy story, amazingly detailed graphics and soothing music. Throw in dominoes or find the object in the picture, and point and click riddles, and a really good gaming flow throught-out the entire thing. It even have some cheap jump scares here and there

I got hooked and finished the game in one sitting, about three hours long. You could get a lot more by playing on expert, and not using hints.

Surprisingly, i look forward for other titles from these guys. It is the first time that i play this type of games, and it was really entertaining.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032148476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1401644189}
review:
Hatte eigentlich keinerlei Interesse das zu zocken, aber nachdem ich mal kurz reingeguckt habe, bin ich nicht mehr von losgekommen. Worum geht es?  
Es ist eine Mischung aus Point&Click Adventure mit Puzzlen, Gegenstandssuche und Wimmelbild-Elementen. Es erzeugt ein unglaublich guten Fluss. Ein Wimmelbild lösen, den neuen Gegenstand im Vorraum nutzen. Zum alten Raum zurück, ein Puzzle dort gelöst und wieder ein neuen Gegenstand bekommen, den man sicher bald wieder braucht. 
Die Rätsel und Puzzle sind logisch, reizvoll und befriedigend, wenn auch recht leicht (Tipp-Funktionen gibt es auch noch). Die Grafik ist für einen kleinen Titel absolut solide (könnte etwas schärfer sein) und die Musik untermalt die Stimmung sehr gut (wenn auch recht wenig Stücke). Das Setting ist unverkennbar von Bioshock abgeguckt, nur statt Rapture heißt die Unterwasserstadt Eden. Die Story um die scheinbar verweiste Stadt hält das ca. 3 Stunden große Spiel  gut beisammen.  
Insgesamt ein Spiel, bei dem man ganz gemütlich abschalten kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016751299', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1405760569}
review:
Suların derinlilklerinde geçen bir hikayeye sahip Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden. Beni en çok çeken kısımlarından biride buydu diyebilirim. Sulak yerde büyümenin getirisi olsa gerek, su gördüğümde merakıma yenik düşüyorum. Neyse lafı gevelemenin alemi yok, oyundan bahsedelim.

Su altında keşif ve araştırma yapan bir çiftin gözünden yaşıyoruz olayları. Eşimiz Robert karanlık güçler olarak düşündüğümüz ancak baştan bilemediğimiz bir şekilde kayboluyor. Biz ise onu önemseyen hayat arkadaşı olarak  tabiri caizse canımızı dişimize takıp, korkmadan, yılmadan, araştırıp keşfederek, bulmacaları çözerek, tıkalı yolları açarak ona ulaşmaya çalışıyoruz. Aramalarımız sırasında bir çok gizeme tanıklık edip bir çok ilginç durumla karşılaşıyoruz. Hikaye içeriğinde sadece Eşimiz ve biz yokuz, diğer karakterleride unutmamak gerek. Bize yardımcı olan ve bize umut bağlamış insanların hikayesine de tanıklık ediyoruz.

Bulmaca oyunlarını seviyorsanız oynamanız gereken bir oyun. Hikayesi, ambiansı, sesleri, bulmacaları gayet iyi bir oyun. Sıkıcı bir uzunlukta değil. 3 Saat gibi bir sürede bitirebilirsiniz. Fiyatı markette 8$  civarında. Bu parayı vermek istemiyorsanız indirim zamanlarını bekleyebilirsiniz. Ya da oyun pakedi yapan Bundle sitelerinden denk gelirse kaçırmayın derim.

Serinin farklı oyunları da var. Gerçi seri demek yanlış olabilir, Nightmare from the Deep serisi haricinde bir ikileme yapım şuana kadar gelmedi, biz kısaca aynı yapımıcının farklı hikayelerde geçen bulmaca oyunları var diyelim. Bu oyunu beğenirseniz onlara da bir göz atmanınızı öneririm.

Kısaca özet geçmeye çalıştım, umarım satın almayı düşünen arkadaşlar için yardımcı olur.
İyi oyunlar ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970952580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1400433627}
review:
「BioShock」に影響を受けたであろう、廃墟となった海底都市を舞台にしたポイント＆クリックの
アドベンチャーゲームです。海底で行方不明になった恋人を探す女性が主人公です。
ドアを開けたりスイッチを入れたりするためのちょっとしたパズルゲームもあったりします。
音声は英語ですが字幕は日本語を選べます。ゲーム画面の中の文字も日本語化されています。
幽霊みたいなのが出てきてちょっと怖いゲームです。だいたい5時間くらいでクリアできるみたいです。
クリアするとこのゲームのサイドストーリーがプレイできます。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970821777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1400338557}
review: If you enjoy hidden object games (which I will refer to as HOG from here on out) you could do much worse than this fun little adventure/HOG hybrid with an obvious Bioshock influence.  Now you may raise your eyebrows when I mention "Bioshock" and "HOG" in the same sentence but this game takes place in an underwater city meant to be a self sufficient utopia. Yeah, the devs had Rapture in mind when they made this but that's not a bad thing as I enjoy that early century art deco look. The story was okay. The voice acting was not. Gameplay was your typical mini-games with hidden object goodness, none of which was too difficult which I liked. The one thing I didn't like was that there is a ton of back tracking. Get this object from here, take it over there and use it on this thing only to go back to where you got it from. Blah. Thankfully there aren't TOO many areas so you won't forget what was where. You can finish the main game and the bonus story in about 4 hours so th length is just right. Oh, and if you don't want to play the hidden object part there's an alternate mah-jong game which is also fun and a nice change. Overall I give this game an 8/10. I got this game in a bundle so watch for those in the future. Otherwise a $3 is a reasonable price to pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1399153850}
review:
Hidden object games are somewhat of a guilty pleasure for me.  I am quite fascinated with them, but generally balk at the idea of ever spending money on them (and there's admittedly no logic to this stance - it's just how it is).  So it was that Abyss (and its predecessor, Nightmares from the Deep) were picked up in bundles along with other games I actually wanted.  But hey, here was my first chance to play a commercial HOG as opposed to all the free ones I've tried on the web and they're actually pretty good.  I played Nightmares first and you can read my review of it here:  http://steamcommunity.com//id/dunetiger/recommended/259740/

So we come to Abyss: the Wraiths of Eden, a casual hidden-object/adventure game unashamedly inspired by and liberally borrowed from Bioshock.  At first, I dismissed the comparisons and thought they were simply tongue-in-cheek comments, but the truth is there is no denying Bioshock's influence on this game.  The story is this: your husband (you play a lady once again) has gone missing on a diving expedition and you're trying to track him down.  You end up in a strange submerged city called Eden (-not- Rapture), solving puzzles to defeat the forces of evil.  Pretty standard stuff.

Compared with Nightmares from the Deep, you now have high-res (720) cutscenes so no more fuzzies when they come up, but character models continue to be creepy and not purposely so.  Like Bioshock, there are little girls running around although they're not zombie creatures being followed by big dudes in diving suits, so at least the comparisons can end there, but I bring them up because they are REALLY weird looking.  I know it's not easy to model faces, but man....

Anyways, the format of the game is pretty much exactly like Nightmares from the Deep, but with a few minor differences.  Like its predecessor, Abyss is filled not just with HOG scenes (I think there's 16 of them to do in total), but also various find-object, use-object puzzles and a few brain teasers, but nothing really difficult.  On expert mode, nothing is pointed out to you and some areas will become pixel hunts; however, if you are playing with children, you might want to lower the difficulty where the game will be a little more forgiving with keeping the pace going.  Where Nightmares had the alternative of mahjong tile matching instead of playing the HOG, Abyss offers as its alternative a weird, but enjoyable domino-style game where you need to lay down dominoes in order to cover icons on a grid.  You're not REALLY playing dominoes, so it's more of a picture-matching exercise than anything else... just like "mahjong".

Other than that, the puzzles here are a little more clever than in Nightmares, and the only word of warning is there are some 'frightening' images that may not be appropriate for younger children.  Although I preferred the theme and story of Nightmares, Abyss is a fine casual game and can be enjoyed by anyone.

The only thing I really disliked in this game was the friggin elevator.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999732661', 'num_games_owned': 1752, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1398782274}
review:
I've played maybe 20-30 hidden object games to date (probably more), and I'd have to say Abyss is indeed one of the better ones out there, but has some flaws that really stuck with me as I played.

First of all, the game is beautiful.  Although the detailed artwork is clearly inspired by the Bioshock series (and a lot of story elements), it looks great with a colorful palette and some imaginative locations.  There are a lot of areas to explore, as well. The music is very nice and does a good job of setting the mood, but can get a bit repetitive after awhile.  

For the game play, this is your standard IHOG/HOPA, basically adventure game lite with Hidden Object Scenes sprinkled in.  As an adventure gamer myself, I always play on Expert to give me a bit of challenge and lengthen my game experience, but I found the game to be on the easy side overall.  Not a horrible thing if you're looking for a relaxing evening, but I prefer my IHOGs to last longer than 4 hours on the hardest difficulty. Even the puzzles were fairly easy taking me only a few minutes to figure most out, and many needing only a few moves to complete.  The most challenging part for me was going back and finding older Hidden Object Scenes that have reactivated; they don't sparkle in Expert, so it's basically a game of "let's click on everything" in the hopes the scene is indeed active again.  I know this is pretty standard for Expert mode in most HOGs, but honestly, it's just an exercise in frustration, not added challenge.  If the devs are reading this, putting in an option for sparkles on reactivated HOS's would be a much welcome addition in future games.

The Hidden Object Scenes themselves are well done, nicely drawn items without too much clutter, and have a nice range of difficulty, but none of the items were what I would consider unfairly hidden.  And although I really enjoy HOS's, I know not everyone is a fan, so the option to play Dominos instead is a nice touch.   The Dominos mini-game itself is fun, relaxing and mildly stimulating,  

While the story took a lot of elements from Bioshock, it didn't resonate with me as much as some of Artifex Mundi's other games.  I know HOG's aren't exactly a great source of deep, thought-provoking storytelling, but I felt like Abyss was flirting with some really interesting concepts, but those ideas kept getting derailed and neutered.

I think my biggest issue came down to the voice acting, though.  Maybe I'm being a little more critical than I should be having come off of a couple of games that had absolutely amazing voice actors, but here...it's just awful.  I wanted so badly to turn off the voices as every time any of the characters uttered something I couldn't help but cringe. If there is anything I would like to see in future HOGs it would be a toggle for the voices.  Sometimes just reading and letting my mind fill in the blanks is better than being stuck with voices that are pulling me out of the experience.

That said, I did enjoy the game quite a bit and can see myself playing it again in the future.  I certainly look forward to some of Artifex Mundi's other games making their way to Steam.

[code][h1]Curated by: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6458642-Hidden-Object-Gamers/]Hidden Object Gamers[/url] & [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33004802-Chudah%27s-Corner/]Chudah's Corner[/url][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999246473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1397166303}
review:
Been a hardcore adventure gamer since the days of text-based glory in the 80s. Never thought I'd care about these hidden object games, to be honest the vast majority of them are tragically primitive. These Artifex Mundi games are not, they're in a class of their own.

There's a lot of classic adventure elements in them, you find items, figure out how to combine said items to achieve the result you're after and thusly advance the storyline. Every now and then you're confronted with a hidden object scene, a fact that makes my eyes water and kills my inner child bit by bit. In a stroke of pure brilliance they've added an option to play an alternative game and that way bypass the hidden object scene entirely. What you're left with is an adventure game and occasional boardgame challenges, fantastic. 

Rather uniquely they also tend to feature strong female protagonists that aren't constantly trying to assert the fact that they're female and strong, they just are. This is something that you'd be hard pressed to find in any other genre.

Finally, it works flawlessly in linux. As have all Artifex Mundi games I've tried so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095677874', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1397672739}
review:
Интересный квест из разряда я ищу на подводную тематику. Хорошо прорисованный подводный мир, приятная музыка, интересные головоломки, не слишком сложные, но и не простые, дети методом проб и ошибок смогут решить их.
Есть конечно элементы хоррора, но впечатления после игры не будут беспокоить игрока по ночам, поэтому рекомендую играть в неё всем: от мала и до велика)
Раскройте тайну Эдема!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023035539', 'num_games_owned': 2099, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1397308826}
review: Un jeu sympa à découvrir à petit prix, une ambiance agréable, une musique qui colle bien à la situation. Des énigmes et des puzzles accessibles à tous, la difficulté n'est pas spécialement au rendez-vous mais le jeu passe bien et on ne se lasse pas. A tester !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973861759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1397348758}
review: Very nicely done.  Sound, artwork... puzzles.  One of the better point-and-click adventures I've played in a while.  The mini games are really creative and enjoyable.  This game is a steal at the full price of USD$8, even more so if it is on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090867676', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1420328075}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071155163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1553081039}
review:
「乱雑な部屋の中から使うんだか使わないんだか
よくわからないアイテムを探すゲーム」は
正直、体験版でお腹いっぱいになっちゃうタイプなのですが
種類豊富な謎解きやしっかりしたストーリー等、
単なるアイテム探しゲームとは全然違う印象がありました。
回転キー操作などの際は前に見つけていたヒントが
主人公の手元メモ的な感じに出てくるので
いちいちメモ書きをしなくても進められるのが良かったです。

日本語化もしっかりしており、主人公の台詞字幕はもちろん
途中で出てくる手紙や壁の文字等もきちんと翻訳されてます。
気になる点としては実績がアンロックされた際
STEAMの通知と一緒にゲーム画面内にも実績のポップアップが出現し、
そこで台詞字幕が隠れてしまうところがあります。
あと、そこまでグロデスクな物ではないのですが
若干のホラー演出があるため小さい子供と一緒にプレーする場合は
注意が必要かもしれません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198056807270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1410911788}
review:
A perfect casual adventure game, makes you think, but never gets frustrating.  Bonus content also very nice.  Took me about 4 hours to complete.  I would have liked longer, but I thoroughly enjoyed my time playing.  It should also be added that the backgrounds have a stylish art deco feel, and are very pleasing to the eyes.

A definite purchase for those who enjoy hidden object/adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982157330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1397354399}
review:
Nice game.  It is a point and click adventure game with the setting of Bioshock!  Really surprising and a nice return even if it is a different place and story line.  Unlike most 'Find the list' of item games, a lot of the game play is adventourous just like Artifex Mundi's "Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart" which I & my 7 year old also enjoyed.
I highly recomend this game if 'Find'em games' are your type/style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040718026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1396717571}
review: Adventure game with hidden picture puzzles and awesome atmosphere. Played through the normal campaign so far and loved it. Nice story, nice atmosphere, nice riddles...and if you dont like them you can either play a mini game, skip them or get hints. Much love to details. Furthermore you get the soundtrack, some wallpapers and an extra campaign.. Very nice! Recommend it to people who like old-school point and click adventures. Best money spent on Steam in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984612018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1418891132}
review: Игрушка в принципе неплохая, мини игры правда довольно просты. Сюжет хилый, но на любителя пойдет. Цена конечно завышена, больше 70-100 не стоит. Брал именно потому что нравится такой жанр.
